0.title: Not true: Punit refutes reports of playing Dev in 'Brahmastra...'
0.article_body: Actor-choreographer Punit Pathak has refuted reports that claimed he played the role of Dev in Ayan Mukerji's 'Brahmastra Part One: Shiva'. "No no no, I have not shot it. It is not true, it is not right. I am not Dev in Brahmastra," he said. The film only shared a glimpse of the character and did not reveal the face.

1.title: Happiest birthday to our vera level all-rounder Ashwin: Karthik
1.article_body: Wishing India all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin on his 36th birthday, teammate Dinesh Karthik tweeted, "Happiest birthday to our vera level all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin. Have a blast Ashley!" He added, "Brb [be right back]...birthday boy taking us on a trip." Virat Kohli took to Instagram Stories and wrote, "Happy birthday, Ash. Wishing you happiness and good health. Have a great day."

2.title: New Tunisian decree imposes 5-yr prison term for 'fake news'
2.article_body: Tunisia's President Kais Saied has issued a decree which imposes a jail term of up to 5 years for convictions in spreading "fake news" cases. The decree is defined as "using communication networks and information systems...to...send false information or rumours". The law says the jail term could be raised up to 10 years if the fake news targets top officials.

3.title: Nobody can play tennis like Federer, nobody probably will ever: Mouratoglou
3.article_body: Paying tribute to Roger Federer after he announced his retirement, Simona Halep's coach Patrick Mouratoglou said the 41-year-old Swiss plays tennis the way everybody would love to play tennis. "Roger is the best ambassador for tennis...nobody can play tennis like him, and nobody probably will ever play tennis the way [he] did," he added. Federer has won 20 Grand Slams.

4.title: 2 groups clash inside a gurdwara in Punjab's Faridkot
4.article_body: Members of two different groups clashed inside a gurdwara in Punjab's Faridkot district over the control of the committee that manages the shrine's affairs. Police have registered a case and arrested three people. Notably, in a video, groups can be seen clashing inside the sanctum sanctorum of the gurdwara located in the city's German Colony area.

5.title: UP Police SI booked for threatening to kill senior officer
5.article_body: An FIR was registered against a UP Police sub-inspector (SI) for allegedly threatening to kill a superintendent of police, officials said on Saturday. The accused, SI Rajendra Singh, was suspended and sent to jail following an incident in March where he shot and injured a neighbour, an official informed. Efforts are underway to arrest the accused policeman, the official added.

6.title: Pak PM to appoint next Army chief in November: Pak Defence Minister
6.article_body: Pakistan's Defence Minister Khawaja Asif on Saturday said PM Shehbaz Sharif will appoint the country's next Army chief in November this year. Further, Asif accused ex-PM Imran Khan of creating controversy. Khan had earlier said Shehbaz was incompetent to make the military appointment and that the decision must be made after fresh elections are held.

7.title: SCO to prepare list of terror groups banned in member states
7.article_body: The Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) will prepare a list of separatist and terrorist groups that are banned on territories of member states. In a declaration, the SCO condemned terrorism in all forms and said the list will be made in accordance with the member countries' national laws. Foreign Secretary Vinay Kwatra said SCO members clearly recognise the threat of terrorism.

8.title: Overpowering director is worst thing you can do: Darshan on working with Kangana
8.article_body: Director Suneel Darshan, sharing his experience of working with Kangana Ranaut in the film 'Shakalaka Boom Boom', said he could sense that "something was amiss". "I also felt...overpowering a director is...worst thing that you can do to a film," he added. Suneel further said he's still a fan of Kangana's acting and believes that she should act in more movies.

9.title: 2-time CWG champion Bajrang loses in Wrestling World C'ships quarters
9.article_body: Two-time Commonwealth Games champion Bajrang Punia lost in the quarter-final at the Wrestling World Championships in Belgrade on Saturday. Yianni Diakomihalis of the USA beat the Indian wrestler 10-0 via technical superiority in the 65-kg category. If the American wrestler reaches the final, Bajrang will have a chance at the bronze medal through the repechage round.

10.title: CBI moves Delhi court to cancel Tejashwi Yadav's bail in IRCTC scam
10.article_body: The CBI has filed an application in a Delhi court seeking cancellation of bail to Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav in the IRCTC scam. The case relates to the maintenance contract of IRCTC hotels in which the agency had charged 12 people and two companies. Tejashwi and his mother Rabri Devi were granted bail in 2018.

11.title: Rohingya teenager in Bangladesh killed in shelling from Myanmar
11.article_body: A 15-year-old Rohingya boy was killed and six others were injured after mortar shells fired from Myanmar exploded on the Bangladeshi side of the Myanmar-Bangladesh border on Friday. The mortar shells landed in no man's land, a Bangladeshi official said, as per media reports. More than a million Rohingya are living in refugee camps in southern Bangladesh.

12.title: Mukesh Ambani makes biggest-ever donation of ₹1.5cr at Kerala's Guruvayur Temple
12.article_body: Billionaire industrialist Mukesh Ambani on Saturday visited Kerala's Guruvayur Shri Krishna Temple and made a donation of ₹1.5 crore, temple officials said. The temple said it was the biggest amount it has received in a single donation ever. This came a day after Ambani visited Lord Venkateshwara Shrine in Andhra Pradesh and made a similar ₹1.5 crore donation.

13.title: Indian hockey players to take legal action against ex-coach Marijne over allegations in book
13.article_body: Indian men's and women's hockey players said they will take a legal action against ex-coach Sjoerd Marijne over allegations he made in his book. Marijne alleged that Manpreet Singh asked a player "to stop playing well" so his friends could get into team. He also alleged ex-FIH president Narinder Batra didn't know the names of female players barring Rani Rampal.

14.title: Jersey worn by basketball legend Michael Jordan 24 years ago sells for over ₹80 crore
14.article_body: A jersey worn by basketball legend Michael Jordan during Game 1 of the 1998 NBA Finals, his last title victory, sold for a record $10.1 million (over ₹80 crore) on Thursday, Sotheby’s said. The Chicago Bulls jersey, with Jordan’s number 23 on the back, went for the highest amount of any game-worn sports memorabilia ever, the auction house said.

15.title: JD(U) has not given Prashant Kishor any offer to join: Party Prez
15.article_body: JD(U) President Rajiv Ranjan Lalan Singh said the party has not given Prashant Kishor any offer to join. "Prashant Kishor is not a political person. He's a businessman and does marketing to increase his business," said Singh, after Kishor met with Bihar CM Nitish Kumar recently. Singh said he had told Kishor to "accept the party's decision irrespective of opinions".

16.title: Hyd Liberation Day wasn't celebrated due to vote bank politics: Shah
16.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah said despite demand from the people, the Telangana government would not "dare to celebrate" Hyderabad Liberation Day due to "vote bank politics". Shah added that the TRS backed out of their election promises "due to fear of Razakars". He also said Hyderabad would not have been part of India if it wasn't for Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel.

17.title: BSF seizes mobile phones worth ₹39 lakh along India-B'desh border
17.article_body: The BSF has seized mobile phones worth ₹39,29,000 in West Bengal's Malda district near the India-Bangladesh International Border. Acting on intelligence inputs, the BSF seized a consignment of 359 mobile phones from "10 to 12 suspected smugglers" who fled seeing the troops. BSF says the names of many Indian smugglers involved in the ring have come up.

18.title: BJP govt against backward classes, poor: Akhilesh Yadav
18.article_body: Former UP CM Akhilesh Yadav accused the BJP-led state government of being against the backward classes and poor people. The Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav criticised the state government for cancelling the public holiday on Vishwakarma Jayanti, which is being celebrated on Saturday across the country. He added that the BJP has insulted the Vishwakarma community.

19.title: BJP will lose upcoming Himachal Assembly polls: State Cong chief
19.article_body: Himachal Pradesh Congress chief Pratibha Singh said that the BJP will lose in the upcoming state Assembly polls. "The defeat of BJP-supported candidates [in the university elections] has made it clear that the wind of change of power is intact in the state," Pratibha said. She added, "Congress will remove the discrimination being faced by the employees."

20.title: Rajnath Singh to embark on 3-day Egypt visit to boost defence ties
20.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh will embark on a three-day visit to Egypt from Sunday. The visit aims to further consolidate defence cooperation and the special friendship between India and Egypt, a press release by the Defence Ministry said. A Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) will be signed to provide further impetus to enhance defence cooperation between the two countries, it added.

21.title: Salman Khan wishes PM 'Narendra bhai Modi' on his 72nd birthday
21.article_body: Actor Salman Khan took to Twitter on Saturday to wish Prime Minister Narendra Modi on his 72nd birthday. "Wishing our hon Prime Minister Narendra bhai Modi a very happy birthday, @narendramodi," he wrote. Meanwhile, actress Alia Bhatt tweeted, "Happy Birthday to our Hon'ble @PMOIndia @narendramodi ji. Here's wishing you good health and a lifetime of inspiring leadership."

22.title: Chrissy shares screenshots of hate comments she got after revealing she had abortion
22.article_body: Model Chrissy Teigen took to Twitter to share screenshots of hate comments directed at her on Instagram after her revelation that she underwent "life-saving" abortion and not miscarriage in 2020. "Stop milking this story," a user wrote. "I knew this would happen...and honestly I've already seen you do your worst so if this makes you feel better, great," Chrissy wrote.

23.title: S Africans seek return of world's largest clear-cut diamond after Queen's death
23.article_body: Demands have grown in South Africa to bring back the 500-carat diamond known as the 'Great Star of Africa' or Cullinan I, which is the world's largest known clear-cut diamond. Over 6,000 South Africans have signed an online petition seeking its return after Queen Elizabeth II's death. The diamond, as big as a human heart, currently adorns the Queen's sceptre.

24.title: Don't start this nonsense about Virat Kohli opening the batting: Gautam Gambhir
24.article_body: Referring to several people stating Virat Kohli should open the batting for India in T20 World Cup 2022, Gautam Gambhir said, "Don't start this nonsense about him opening...He can't open...with KL Rahul and Rohit Sharma available." He added, "There shouldn't even be a debate about this." Notably, Kohli slammed his maiden T20I hundred while opening against Afghanistan in Asia Cup.

25.title: Man City beat 10-man Wolves 3-0 in PL, move to top of the standings
25.article_body: Jack Grealish's goal inside 60 seconds and Erling Haaland's 11th Premier League goal of the season helped Manchester City beat 10-man Wolverhampton Wanderers 3-0 on Saturday. Phil Foden netted a third in the 69th minute as the defending champions moved to the top of the Premier League standings. Manchester City have 17 points from seven matches so far.

26.title: Protests erupt at funeral of Iranian woman allegedly beaten by police
26.article_body: Protests broke out at the funeral of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini who died on Friday after allegedly being assaulted by police in Iran over "improper hijab", Reuters reported. Videos posted on social media reportedly showed protesters shouting anti-government slogans after gathering in Saqqez, Amini's hometown. Security forces fired tear gas to disperse demonstrators, as per Reuters.

27.title: 7 dead, several hurt as bus falls off bridge in J'khand; 'Anguished,' says PM
27.article_body: At least seven people were killed and several others were injured after a bus carrying around 50 passengers fell off a bridge in Jharkhand's Hazaribag on Saturday, police said. A rescue operation is underway as some passengers are still trapped in the bus, Hazaribag SP said. "Anguished by the loss of lives in the bus accident," PM Narendra Modi tweeted.

28.title: New world record set as 87,000 donate blood on PM's birthday: Health Minister
28.article_body: Over 87,000 people voluntarily donated blood on PM Narendra Modi's birthday on Saturday, setting a new world record, Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya said. "This is an invaluable gift from the country to our beloved Pradhan Sevak," said Mandaviya. A countrywide 15-day voluntary blood donation drive has been launched starting today and ending on October 1.

29.title: Hrithik recalls doctors telling him he 'can't do action films and dance'
29.article_body: Hrithik Roshan spoke about the time when doctors told him that he can't do action films and dance. He said, "When I did 'Kaho Naa...Pyaar Hai', doctors had said that my health condition is not so good. That I can't do action films and dance." Hrithik added that he took it as a challenge and paid attention to his health.

30.title: AAP MLA Amanatullah sent to 4-day police custody in corruption case
30.article_body: AAP MLA Amanatullah Khan was on Saturday sent to four-day police custody in the Delhi Waqf Board corruption case. The order was issued by a special Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) court at Rouse Avenue. Khan was arrested late on Friday by the Anti-Corruption Branch (ACB) after raids at the residences of the MLA and his aide.

31.title: India didn't give freebies during pandemic, gave ration to 80 cr people: UP CM
31.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Saturday claimed that India was the only country in the world that did not give freebies during the COVID-19 pandemic, but helped 80 crore people with free ration. Addressing a gathering in Lucknow after inaugurating an exhibition to mark PM Modi's birthday, he said, "More than 200 crore free vaccine doses were...made available."

32.title: Your mantra should be skilling, reskilling & upskilling: PM Modi to youth
32.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi gave the mantra of "skilling, reskilling and upskilling" to the youth of the country. Addressing the Kaushal Dikshant Samaroh, he advised the youth to innovate and constantly update their abilities in accordance with the changing times. The Centre will launch more than 5,000 new 'skill hubs' in order to support skill development, PM Modi added.

33.title: Several women injured after bus collides against bridge in UP
33.article_body: Over two dozen women were injured after the bus they were travelling in collided against a bridge in Uttar Pradesh. The bus was carrying people returning from Prime Minister Narendra Modi's Women's Self-Help Group (SHG) programme held in Madhya Pradesh's Karahal Tehsil. The bus could not reach the programme due to a traffic jam.

34.title: Shah to visit Bihar next week for 1st time after JD(U)-BJP break up
34.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah will visit Bihar on September 23 and 24, BJP state President Sanjay Jaiswal said on Saturday. This will be Shah's first visit to Bihar after CM Nitish Kumar-led JD(U) broke ties with BJP. Jaiswal said Shah will address a big public gathering in Purnia and will meet the office bearers of Araria, Kishanganj, Purnia and Katihar.

35.title: Team India will be happy that he is scoring runs: Johnson on Kohli
35.article_body: Former Australia pacer Mitchell Johnson has said Team India will be happy with batter Virat Kohli scoring runs again. This month, Kohli ended his 1,019-day international century drought by smashing his 71st hundred against Afghanistan in the Asia Cup 2022. With 276 runs from five matches, Kohli finished as the second-highest run scorer in the Asia Cup.

36.title: 74 yrs ago, Sardar Patel came to unite, now Amit Shah came to divide: KT Rao
36.article_body: Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao accused Union Home Minister Amit Shah of doing "divisive politics". Rao said, "74 years ago, a Union Home Minister (Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel) came to unite and integrate the people of Telangana." He added, "Today [Amit Shah] has come to divide and bully." Shah visited the state on the occasion of Hyderabad Liberation Day on Saturday.

37.title: Rohit never looks out of form whether he's scoring runs or not: Narine
37.article_body: West Indies spinner Sunil Narine lauded Rohit Sharma, saying the India captain is a quality player and there is no doubt about his ability. "I think once he is on the go, he is one of the best batters to watch. He is always in form, never looks out of form whether he is scoring runs or not," he added.

38.title: 45-year-old man injured in crocodile attack in Odisha's Kendrapara
38.article_body: A 45-year-old man was attacked by a crocodile in Odisha's Kendrapara district on Saturday, an official said. He sustained multiple wounds and is undergoing treatment. The victim was taking a bath in the Brahmani river when the incident occurred, PTI reported. The crocodile tried to pull the man into the deep water but he was rescued by locals.

39.title: Original Shiv Sena can't be snatched away or purchased: Uddhav
39.article_body: Former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Saturday said that the "original" Shiv Sena was "born out of decades of social work", adding that the party cannot be "snatched away or purchased". This comes amid the ongoing tussle between the factions led by Thackeray and Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde over the right to use Shiv Sena's poll symbol.

40.title: 'World's first flying bike' debuts at US event, video goes viral
40.article_body: Japanese-made hoverbike XTURISMO, which is widely regarded as the world's first flying bike, debuted at a US auto show on Thursday. A video of a show official test-driving the bike has gone viral online. XTURISMO maker AERWINS Technologies plans to launch it in the US next year with its price pegged at $777,000 (around ₹6.18 crore).

41.title: Heavy rainfall warning issued for several states, list released
41.article_body: The IMD has issued heavy rainfall warning for several states. Heavy rainfall is very likely over UP and MP on September 20 and 21. It's likely over Chhattisgarh from September 19 to 21, over Andaman and Nicobar Islands till September 20 and over Odisha from September 18-21. Very heavy rainfall is likely over Odisha on September 20 and 21.

42.title: We'll wrap it up by Dec, it'll be an early 2023 release: Sunny on Gadar 2
42.article_body: Actor Sunny Deol has said he's very confident about his upcoming film 'Gadar 2', the sequel to the 2001 film 'Gadar: Ek Prem Katha'. "Whomever I meet wants to see something and we are giving them that in Gadar," he added. Sunny further said the film will be completed by December and will release in early 2023.

43.title: TN shopkeeper denies candies to Dalit kids, arrested after video emerges
43.article_body: A shopkeeper and a village leader were arrested on Saturday after the former denied candies to Dalit children in Tamil Nadu's Tenkasi. This comes after a viral video showed the shopkeeper, Maheshwaran, telling the children that village authorities have imposed a restriction against selling anything to residents of a particular street. "You shouldn't buy...[candies] from...shops here," he added.

44.title: I feel 'boycott Bollywood' campaign is extremely good: Vivek Agnihotri
44.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Ranjan Agnihotri said in an interview that he feels the 'boycott Bollywood' campaign is "extremely good" as it shows people's frustration with the kind of films that Bollywood is producing. 'The Kashmir Files' director added that its end result will be "very positive". When asked if he considers himself a part of Bollywood, Vivek replied, "No, I'm not."

45.title: Goa CM calls for preserving coastline to boost blue economy
45.article_body: The Goa government on Saturday carried out a cleanliness drive at 37 beaches, where CM Pramod Sawant stressed the need to preserve the coastline for boosting blue economy. "We should pledge to continue working with unity for a better, safe and sustainable future," Sawant tweeted. The state tourism department organised cleanliness drive on the occasion of PM Narendra Modi's birthday.

46.title: Midnight fire guts 6 vehicles in Pune
46.article_body: A midnight fire broke out at a parking lot of Hareshwar Park residential society, Manajinagar in Pune's Narhe on Saturday. The fire gutted six vehicles, including two cars, before the firefighters reached the spot and brought the situation under control. Fire officer Prakash Gore cited short-circuit as the possible reason for the blaze. Notably, the investigation is still on.

47.title: Youth marking PM Modi's birthday as 'National Unemployment Day': Cong
47.article_body: The Congress on Saturday claimed that the youth of the country are marking PM Narendra Modi's birthday as "National Unemployment Day". They demanded that he provide employment to them as promised. "In fact, in the 20-24 age group, 42% of the youth are unemployed. If this is not a worrying situation, I wonder what is," Congress spokesperson Supriya Shrinate said.

48.title: Bidar-Ballari road will be made a 4-lane express highway: K'taka CM
48.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Saturday announced that the existing Bidar-Ballari road will be made a four-lane express highway. Speaking in Kalaburagi, Bommai said the proposed express highway will play an important role in improving the road connectivity in the region. A ring road has been proposed covering Yadgir, Raichur and Kalaburagi with the Centre's assistance, Bommai added.

49.title: 32 gold bars worth ₹1.64 crore found in plane's toilet in Chennai
49.article_body: As many as 32 gold bars, weighing 3.73 kilograms, worth ₹1.64 crore were seized from an aeroplane that arrived in Chennai from Dubai at the city airport, Customs authorities said on Saturday. Officials, while rummaging the aircraft belonging to a private airline, found the gold bars concealed in the front toilet of the plane, according to an official release.

50.title: 2 men electrocuted after coming in contact with electric wire in UP
50.article_body: Two men were electrocuted to death after they came in contact with an electric wire in Uttar Pradesh's Balrampur, a police officer said on Saturday. The deceased were identified as 33-year-old Anup Yadav and 40-year-old Virendra Yadav. Anup came in contact with the wire while removing a wooden pole in his field and Virendra was electrocuted while rescuing him.

51.title: Which popular brands risk losing royal seal after Queen Elizabeth's death?
51.article_body: Around 600 brands favoured by Queen Elizabeth II are at the risk of losing the royal seal and must await King Charles III's approval. Burberry raincoats, Cadbury chocolates, Twinings teas and coffees, Launer handbags and Moet and Chandon champagne are among them. Dubonnet wine-based aperitif and Barbour jackets were favoured by the Queen, as were Heinz ketchup and Kellogg's cereal.

52.title: Class: Patrick on Federer announcing his retirement after the end of US Open
52.article_body: Praising Roger Federer for the timing of announcing his retirement, ex-tennis player Patrick McEnroe said, "He waited until well after the US Open ended until he went public...Class." US Open, the last Grand Slam of the year, ended on September 11. Federer announced the news on Thursday, saying that he will be retiring after next week's Laver Cup in London.

53.title: Satellite pics show massive queues to see Queen's coffin in London
53.article_body: Maxar's satellite pictures have shown the massive miles-long queues to view Queen Elizabeth II lying-in-state at London's Westminster Hall. Tens of thousands joined the queue, when it opened on Wednesday (September 14), to pay their last respects to the UK's longest-ruling monarch. Queen Elizabeth's funeral, which will be attended by world leaders, is scheduled for Monday (September 19).

54.title: I have changed: Hales after making a comeback to Eng squad after 3 years
54.article_body: After making a comeback to the England squad for the first time since 2019, batter Alex Hales said that he has "changed" in the past three years. "I'm comfortably into my 30s now and turning into a veteran," Hales said. "It was disappointing not to be in the team for three years," he added.

55.title: Bomb explodes on terrace of school in West Bengal; none injured
55.article_body: A bomb exploded on the terrace of Titagarh Free India High School in West Bengal's North 24 Parganas district on Saturday. Police have reached the spot and are investigating whether someone threw the bomb from outside or if it was stored on the roof. So far, no injuries have been reported in the incident, as per reports.

56.title: Angad Bedi, Kirti Kulhari to reunite after 6 years for 'The List'
56.article_body: Actors Angad Bedi and Kirti Kulhari are teaming up again, after the 2016 movie 'Pink', for a short film titled 'The List'. It's a futuristic drama which is directed by Gaurav Dave. Speaking about the film, Angad said, "The film is...a commentary on how robotic our...lives have become and Gaurav truly believed...Kirti and I'd be able to manifest this on-screen."

57.title: You are the motivation of young India: Saaina to PM Modi on his 72nd birthday
57.article_body: Indian shuttler Saaina Nehwal took to Twitter on PM Narendra Modi's 72nd birthday and wrote, "May God give you good health and long life. You are the motivation of young India and the role model of every ordinary person." CWG 2022 gold medal-winning weightlifter Mirabai Chanu tweeted, "Wishing you a long and healthy life in the service of the nation."

58.title: Delhi recorded this year's first 'good' air quality day on Friday
58.article_body: Delhi recorded this year's first 'good' air quality day on Friday with AQI of 47. AQI till 50 is considered 'good', while AQI of 51 to 100 is classified as 'satisfactory' which could lead to "minor breathing discomfort to sensitive people", as per the Central Pollution Control Board. Delhi recorded only one day of good air quality last year.

59.title: Federer to get warm farewell at Swiss Indoors Basel: Tournament Prez Brennwald
59.article_body: Swiss Roger Federer will be given a "warm farewell" in St Jakobshalle, said President of Swiss Indoors Basel ATP 500 tournament Roger Brennwald. "Further information will follow at a later date," he added. Federer has won a record 10 singles titles in Basel. The 20-time Grand Slam champion will be retiring after next week's Laver Cup.

60.title: 3 injured after SUV rams into vehicle carrying iron rods in NCR
60.article_body: Three people were seriously injured after an SUV rammed into a tractor-trolley, carrying iron rods, from behind on the Delhi-Gurugram national highway on Saturday, police said. The iron rods protruding from the tractor-trolley pierced through the SUV, injuring three of its five occupants, as per an eyewitness. The rods pierced through the neck of the car's driver, the eyewitness added.

61.title: More AAP MLAs will be arrested: Kejriwal after Amanatullah's arrest
61.article_body: Delhi CM and AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday said that following the arrest of Amanatullah Khan, several other AAP MLAs will face arrest in the coming days. "It seems they (BJP) are hurt badly in Gujarat," Kejriwal added. AAP MLA Amanatullah Khan was arrested on Friday by Delhi Anti-Corruption Branch in a case linked to the Delhi Waqf Board.

62.title: TN BJP to gift ₹5,000 gold rings to newborns on PM Modi's birthday
62.article_body: BJP's Tamil Nadu unit has planned to gift gold rings to newborns at a government hospital in Chennai on PM Narendra Modi's birthday. "All children born [at RSRM hospital] on [PM's] birthday will be given a...ring," minister L Murugan said. He estimated that each ring will cost approximately ₹5,000. The party expects about 10-15 deliveries at the hospital today (Saturday).

63.title: NDMC to revamp 41 roads ahead of India's G-20 presidency
63.article_body: Before India assumes the presidency of G-20 this December, the New Delhi Municipal Council (NDMC) will revamp 41 roads and major traffic circles in the city at a cost of ₹85 crore. The municipality has set a deadline of four months to finish the work. During India's G-20 presidency, 12,000 delegates will visit the capital, officials said.

64.title: Congo Prez's top aide caught demanding bribe on tape, resigns
64.article_body: A top adviser of Congolese President Felix Tshisekedi resigned on Friday after he was allegedly caught on tape negotiating kickbacks on a mineral deal. Media organisation Organised Crime and Corruption Reporting Project said Vidiye Tshimanga was recorded negotiating his "percentage" for the deal by two individuals posing as mineral investors. Tshimanga has refuted the allegations against himself.

65.title: Ranvir Shorey’s father, filmmaker Krishan Dev Shorey, passes away at 92
65.article_body: Actor Ranvir Shorey’s father, filmmaker Krishan Dev Shorey, passed away aged 92 on Friday night. Ranvir took to Instagram to condole his father’s death, and called him his "greatest source of inspiration and protection". KD Shorey produced several films in the 1980s and 1990s under his banner KDS Films.

66.title: Pune municipal schools facing shortage of teachers: NCP leader
66.article_body: Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) leader Nitin Kadam said there is a shortage of English-medium teachers in schools under Pune Municipal Corporation. He said many parents lost their income source during the COVID-19 pandemic and so many children were transferred to municipal schools from private English ones. Kadam said there is a shortage of teachers for these new students.

67.title: PMPML criticised for cutting e-bus fleet in Pune for ops in Satara
67.article_body: The Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) has been criticised for providing its e-buses to serve tourists at 'Kas Pathar' in Satara district. Activists said Pune needs more e-buses and that Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation should provide buses for 'Kas Pathar'. As per plans, the PMPML will initially provide five e-buses for the 'Kas Pathar' tourist site.

68.title: Ayushmann's 'Dream Girl 2' to clash with Kartik's 'Satyaprem...' in June 2023
68.article_body: Ayushmann Khurrana's 'Dream Girl 2' is set to clash with Kartik Aaryan and Kiara Advani-starrer 'Satyaprem Ki Katha' next year. Both films are slated to release in theatres on June 29. Directed by Raaj Shaandilyaa, 'Dream Girl 2' will also feature Ananya Panday and Paresh Rawal among others in pivotal roles. 'Satyaprem Ki Katha' is being directed by Sameer Vidwans.

69.title: T'gana CM KCR inaugurates Adivasi Bhavan, Banjara bhavan in Hyderabad
69.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Saturday inaugurated Komaram Bheem Adivasi Bhavan and Sevalal Banjara building in Hyderabad. "The mere inauguration of these buildings won't...transform the situation of what they went through. There's still a long way to go in that direction," KCR said. These buildings will serve as platforms to discuss issues of both the communities, he added.

70.title: Frontline bank staff should be well-versed in local languages: FM
70.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that it is important to have staff who are well-versed in local languages at banks. "We cannot have staff who don't speak the local language and...demand from citizens that they speak in a particular language," she said, adding that banks need to look at language skills of the staff posted at branch levels.

71.title: Russian troops setting up new defensive line in northeast Ukraine: UK
71.article_body: UK's Defence Ministry said Russian troops were working on establishing a new defensive line in Ukraine's northeast. The line likely is between the Oskil River and the town of Svatove, some 150 kilometres southeast of Ukraine's second-largest city Kharkiv, it added. This comes as a counteroffensive operation saw Ukrainian forces recapture large parts of land in the northeastern Kharkiv region.

72.title: Ocean farming startup Sea6 Energy raises $18.5 mn in Series B round
72.article_body: Ocean farming startup Sea6 Energy has raised $18.5 million in a Series B funding round from investors such as BASF Venture Capital and Aqua-Spark. The Bengaluru-headquartered startup produces and processes tropical red seaweed. It also aims to reduce India's dependency on imported oil by replacing fossil fuels with biofuels. It has also converted seaweed into bio-stimulants.

73.title: BMC soon to take over maintenance of 2 major roads of Mumbai
73.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) will take over the maintenance of Mumbai's two roads, namely the Western and Eastern Express Highways. The BMC Commissioner Iqbal Singh Chahal said that the handover decision from the Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority (MMRDA) to the civic body was taken on September 16 at a meeting headed by CM Eknath Shinde.

74.title: Adani becomes 2nd largest cement firm after Ambuja, ACC acquisition
74.article_body: With the completion of the acquisition of Ambuja Cements and ACC, Adani Group has now become the country's second-largest cement player. Holcim sold its entire stake in Ambuja Cements at ₹385 apiece and in ACC at ₹2,300 apiece. Adani Group Chairperson Gautam Adani tweeted about the development and said, "We will double our capacity in the next five years."

75.title: IIT Guwahati student dies by suicide in hostel room, probe underway
75.article_body: A student from IIT Guwahati allegedly died by suicide in his hostel room on Friday night, officials said. The deceased, identified as Surya Narayan Premkishore, was a final-year undergraduate student and hailed from Kerala, reports said. Police have started an investigation after registering a case of unnatural death. According to reports, the reason behind the step is not yet known.

76.title: Pakistan 'super floods' impacted 16 million children: UNICEF
76.article_body: An estimated 16 million children have been impacted by "super floods" in Pakistan, UNICEF said. "Young children are living out in the open with their families, with no drinking water, no food and no livelihood, exposed to a wide range of new flood-related risks and hazards, from damaged buildings, drowning in flood waters and snakes," UNICEF representative Abdullah Fadil said.

77.title: Banking has biggest role to make India developed nation by 2047: FM
77.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that trajectory of Indian Banks' Association (IBA) is aligned with free India's trajectory. She stated, "The biggest role to make India a developed country by 2047 is of the banking sector." "I have a sense of gratitude for banks...You have gone through the test of fire," she added, appreciating their work during the COVID-19 pandemic.

78.title: Man helps wife deliver baby on highway, uses phone chargers to tie umbilical cord in US
78.article_body: A couple recently delivered their daughter on the side of a highway in US, with the woman saying that her husband used two phone chargers to tie off the umbilical cord. She revealed they were on their way to a hospital when she realised she wasn't going to make it on time. Both the mother and baby are healthy.

79.title: 4 killed, 8 injured as SUV collides head-on with truck in Chittorgarh
79.article_body: Four people died and eight others were injured after an SUV collided head-on with a truck in Rajasthan's Chittorgarh district on Friday. The accident occurred while the occupants of the SUV were returning from Udaipur to Indore after attending the last rites of a relative, according to police. The injured were referred from Mangalwad to Udaipur after primary treatment.

80.title: Dalai Lama wishes PM on his birthday, praises India's fight against COVID-19
80.article_body: Tibetan spiritual leader Dalai Lama wished Prime Minister Narendra Modi on his 72nd birthday and praised India for its fight against COVID-19. "It's wonderful that India has successfully met the challenges posed by the coronavirus pandemic. Although we have not seen the complete end of it, India today is better placed to address similar challenges in the future," he said.

81.title: So happy & proud: Kriti's mother pens note after actress wins Filmfare award
81.article_body: Actress Kriti Sanon's mother Geeta Sanon took to Instagram and congratulated her daughter for bagging the Best Actress award at the 67th Filmfare Awards. "Distance couldn't stop us from sharing...happy moment of having another black lady in your hand," she wrote, adding, "I'm so happy and proud, my girl. Surely many more of such glorious moments will come your way."

82.title: Youth responsible for strengthening democratic institutions: Om Birla
82.article_body: Talking about the role of youth in nation building, Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla said that the younger generation is responsible for bolstering democratic institutions across the country. "New innovations in the world are taking us on the path of prosperity...The youth, as future nation builders, must understand the process and procedure of legislation," said Birla.

83.title: Police seize drug peddler's properties worth ₹1.60 crore in Bengaluru
83.article_body: Karnataka City Central Crime Branch on Saturday seized properties worth ₹1.60 crore belonging to a drug peddler in Bengaluru. Police said Mrutyunjaya alias Jayanna had purchased movable and immovable assets through the money minted in the drug peddling nexus. He was arrested in July and ₹80 lakh worth of hashish oil and ganja had been seized.

84.title: 19-yr-old gets life imprisonment for murdering man in 2019 in Rajasthan
84.article_body: A POCSO court in Rajasthan's Kota has awarded a life term to a 19-year-old youth for murdering a man here three years ago. The convict was 16 years old when he murdered a 21-year-old fellow villager in March 2019 over suspicion of a love affair with his sister. The youth had dumped the victim's body near a pond.

85.title: US Prez Biden meets families of Americans jailed in Russia
85.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Friday met the families of two Americans, Brittney Griner and Paul Whelan, detained in Russia. Biden reassured them that he was working to bring Griner and Whelan back home. Basketball player Brittney Griner is currently serving a nine-year prison sentence on drug charges, while ex-US Marine Whelan is serving a 16-year sentence on espionage-related charges.

86.title: Ex-Union Minister & Congress leader Manikrao Gavit dies at 87 in Nashik
86.article_body: Manikrao Gavit, former Union Minister and Congress MP, passed away at the age of 87 on Saturday. He had been ill for some time and died in a hospital in Maharashtra's Nashik. A nine-time Lok Sabha MP, Gavit represented the tribal-dominated Nandurbar constituency between 1980 and 2009. He also served as Minister of State for Social Justice during UPA government.

87.title: PM Modi recalls visiting his mother on birthdays, says 'I couldn't go this time'
87.article_body: PM Modi, while addressing an event of women's self-help groups, recalled birthday visits to his mother Heeraben Modi. "Usually, on this day, I try to visit my mother, touch her feet and take her blessings. But today, I could not go...But lakhs of women in Madhya Pradesh are giving me their blessings," said PM Modi.

88.title: No. 4 is good for me: Suryakumar on his preferred batting position
88.article_body: Talking about his preferred batting position, Team India batter Suryakumar Yadav said he has loved batting at every spot but the number four is a good position for him. "The situation that I go into bat allows me to control the game. I have enjoyed myself most when I bat between overs seven and 15," he added.

89.title: Automobile offender arrested in Hyd, two-wheelers worth ₹10 lakh seized
89.article_body: Hyderabad's Chilkalguda police arrested one automobile offender, identified as 24-year-old Thumma Adithya, and recovered two-wheelers worth ₹10 lakh from him. The accused was a resident of Hyderabad's Musheerabad, police stated. The police began investigation after receiving a complaint from Shaik Abdul Kaleem, who stated that his two-wheeler went missing near Jamia Osmania on September 11.

90.title: Congo national held for trying to smuggle 1.5 kg cocaine in Mumbai
90.article_body: The Directorate of Revenue Intelligence arrested a 50-year-old Congo national, identified as Alfa Tsouke, for allegedly trying to smuggle 1.5 kg of cocaine stuffed in 115 pallets concealed inside his body in Mumbai. According to the DRI officials, Tsouke was detained 11 days ago from the Mumbai international airport. After questioning, the accused was admitted to JJ Hospital, officials said.

91.title: Gyanvapi mosque case could go the Babri Masjid way: Owaisi
91.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said the Varanasi court's order on Gyanvapi mosque has opened the door for endless litigation. The court dismissed a plea against Hindu women seeking to worship inside Gyanvapi. "If this litigation continues, it will go on the path of the Babri Masjid case. It appears we are going back to the 1980s and 1990s," said Owaisi.

92.title: Portable fingerprint scanner finds 3,294 criminal records matches in K'taka
92.article_body: The Automated Fingerprint Identification System linked to a portable fingerprint scanner in Karnataka has checked 93,645 fingerprints over the last year-and-a-half. The system has found 3,294 matches with criminal records, reports said. "There are over 2 lakh fingerprints of persons involved in property crimes in the database," an official said.

93.title: Jamia Millia Islamia bans Safoora Zargar from entering university campus
93.article_body: Jamia Millia Islamia has banned activist Safoora Zargar from entering the university campus. "It has been observed that Ms Safoora Zargar (ex-student) has been involved in organising agitations...against the irrelevant (issues)...to disturb the peaceful academic environment with few students who are mostly outsiders," the order states. Notably, this comes after her MPhil admission was cancelled.

94.title: Partha Chatterjee sent to CBI custody till September 21 in SSC scam
94.article_body: A court sent suspended TMC leader and former West Bengal Education Minister Partha Chatterjee to CBI custody till September 21 in connection with the School Service Commission appointments scam case. "The magnitude of the crime is huge. More things are yet to be clarified...in order to get a transparent probe we demanded CBI custody for Chatterjee," the CBI lawyer said.

95.title: Neena lived on her own terms & made society accept her: Satish Kaushik
95.article_body: Actor-filmmaker Satish Kaushik, who has teamed up with Neena Gupta for his next directorial 'Kaagaz 2', has said the actress "stood for herself in a society which did not accept a lot of things back then". He added that she lived on her own terms and made society accept her. "That's something I've always admired in her," said Satish.

96.title: 5 bike-borne men open fire on labour contractor in Thane
96.article_body: Five-bike borne men opened fire on a labour contractor, identified as Ganesh Kokate, in Thane in the early hours of Saturday, police said. Kokate was travelling in his car, when the accused shot at the vehicle at point-blank range, senior inspector Sulabha Patil said, adding Kokate did not sustain any injuries. The five accused escaped from the scene, she added.

97.title: 5 of family, including 2 kids, killed in car-truck collision near Ahmedabad
97.article_body: A family of five, including two children aged one and ten, died in a collision on the Dhandhuka-Bagodara highway on the outskirts of Ahmedabad on Friday night. According to police, the incident occurred when the truck was going towards Bagodara, while the car was coming from the opposite direction. "An FIR was lodged...and we've detained the driver," an official said.

98.title: Bodies' limbs broken, some had ropes around necks: Ukraine Prez as 440 bodies found
98.article_body: After a mass burial site with over 440 bodies was found in Izium, that was recaptured from Russian forces by Ukraine, the country's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said some of the dead were tortured with ropes around their necks and broken limbs. Several bodies had their hands tied behind their backs. Zelenskyy called it a "proof of war crime by invader".

99.title: My time with coaching has come to an end: Ravi Shastri
99.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri suggested he won't take up coaching jobs. "My time with coaching has come to an end. For seven years, I've done enough." He added, "If I'm doing some coaching, it'll be at the grassroots level, for which I have a company that is doing it...Now I'll view the game from far away and enjoy it."

100.title: Why will stars do my film when they get ₹50 cr for 1 gutkha ad: Prakash Jha
100.article_body: Filmmaker Prakash Jha in an interview spoke about his previous remark that he struggles to cast stars in his projects. He said, "Why will they work in my films when they get ₹50 crore for doing one gutkha advertisement?" "When stars take time out from selling gutkhas and want to focus on content, they will come to me," Prakash added.

101.title: Dutch town sues Twitter over 'satanic' paedophile conspiracy theories
101.article_body: A Dutch town has taken Twitter to court over the spread of a conspiracy theory claiming it was once home to a ring of 'Satan-worshipping paedophiles'. Reports claiming Bodegraven-Reeuwijk was the site of abuse of multiple children in the 1980s were first circulated by three men in 2020. The main instigator said he'd witnessed the crimes as a child.

102.title: PM Modi shares new pictures after releasing cheetahs in national park
102.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi took to Twitter to share new pictures after releasing cheetahs in Madhya Pradesh's Kuno National Park. He wrote, "A long wait is over, the Cheetahs have a home in India at the Kuno National Park." As many as eight cheetahs have been brought from Namibia to reintroduce the species in India after 70 years.

103.title: India trail Norway 0-2 after 1st day of Davis Cup World Group I tie
103.article_body: Indian tennis team trailed hosts Norway 0-2 at the end of the first day of Davis Cup World Group I tie in Lillehammer on Friday. In first match, Prajnesh Gunneswaran lost to world number two Casper Ruud 1-6, 4-6. Ramkumar Ramanathan, India's highest-ranked men's singles player at 276, lost to world number 325 Viktor Durasovic 1-6, 4-6 in second match.

104.title: TRS leader's car vandalised as it blocks Amit Shah's convoy in Hyd: Report
104.article_body: TRS leader Gosula Srinivas' car was reportedly vandalised after it blocked Home Minister Amit Shah's convoy in Hyderabad on Saturday. The car was found parked at a hotel's door when Shah's convoy came near the hotel, reports said. "The car stopped just like that. I was in tension. I will speak to [police officers]. They vandalised the car," Srinivas said.

105.title: Iran Prez orders probe after woman dies in 'morality police' custody
105.article_body: Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi has ordered an investigation into the death of a 22-year-old-woman who died days after being arrested by the country's "morality police". Mahsa Amini was reportedly arrested on Tuesday over 'improper hijab'. Police have denied allegations that Amini was physically abused and said that she was taken to a hospital after she suffered a heart attack.

106.title: Take a day off and enjoy your birthday, sir: SRK to PM Modi on his 72nd birthday
106.article_body: Wishing Prime Minister Narendra Modi on his 72nd birthday, actor Shah Rukh Khan tweeted, "Your dedication for the welfare of our country and its people is highly appreciated." He added, "May you have the strength and health to achieve all your goals. Take a day off and enjoy your birthday, sir. Happy Birthday."

107.title: Salesman arrested for printing fake Indian currency notes in Mumbai
107.article_body: A 22-year-old salesman was arrested for allegedly printing fake Indian currency notes worth lakhs in Mumbai. The accused, Rohit Shah, used to print fake Indian currency notes of ₹200, ₹100 and ₹50 from a house in Mankhurd, police said. Notably, the police seized several items, including equipment used in printing fake currency, during the raid at the house.

108.title: Google accidentally pays ₹2 crore to US hacker, says 'we're working to correct it'
108.article_body: Google has confirmed that it accidentally paid an American hacker $250,000 (nearly ₹2 crore) after he tweeted about receiving the money in his account. "It's been a little over 3 weeks since Google randomly sent me $249,999 and I still haven't heard anything," Sam Curry had tweeted. Putting the blame on "human error", Google said it's working to correct it.

109.title: Divisive forces using National Integration Day for their 'selfish politics': KCR
109.article_body: On the occasion of Telangana National Integration Day, CM KCR said that divisive forces are using the occasion for their "narrow and selfish politics". He also asked people to make sure that the state doesn’t go down the rabbit hole of hatred. He added that the struggle, strategies, and sacrifices made by the people are well known.

110.title: I don't think fielding is crucial in T20 cricket: Sanjay Manjrekar
110.article_body: Ex-India batter Sanjay Manjrekar said he doesn't think fielding is crucial in T20 cricket. "If somebody has got brilliant skills in batting and bowling, then maybe fielding can be ignored," added Manjrekar. Manjrekar made these remarks after being asked for his opinion on whether all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin fits into Team India's T20 World Cup 2022 squad considering his fielding.

111.title: World’s biggest Ethereum mining firm shuts down servers after Merge
111.article_body: Ethermine, the largest Ethereum mining services provider by computing power, shut down its servers after Ethereum shifted from proof-of-work system to proof-of-stake on Thursday. The shift called the Merge doesn't allow miners to use graphic cards to validate transactions. Ethermine said that a few days after the Merge it'll trigger an automatic payout to its miners for any unpaid balances.

112.title: Slogans raised in Hyd before T'gana Home Minister to release Raja Singh
112.article_body: Supporters of jailed BJP MLA Raja Singh on Friday demanded his release by raising slogans at a function hall in Hyderabad in front of Telangana Home Minister Mohammed Mahmood Ali. They denounced the invoking of Preventive Detention Act against Singh and raised slogans against the Telangana government. TRS workers raised counter slogans. Police pushed the protesters out of the hall.

113.title: 14-yr-old girl sold by mother's partner for ₹3 lakh, raped in Raj
113.article_body: A zero FIR was filed after a 14-year-old girl from Rajasthan's Dholpur was allegedly sold for ₹3 lakh by her mother's live-in partner to a man, who then reportedly illegally married her and raped her, police said. The incident came to light after the girl managed to escape and reach Jaipur, where she was found by Bachpan Bachao Andolan members.

114.title: Gujarat CM launches world’s largest blood donation drive on PM’s birthday
114.article_body: On the occasion of PM Modi's 72nd birthday, Gujarat CM Bhupendra Patel launched the world's largest blood donation drive in Ahmedabad. He congratulated the organisers and said, "Such a big event for blood donation has been organised for the first time. PM Modi has always given priority to the works of service."

115.title: 'Project Cheetah' govt's attempt to preserve environment, wildlife: PM Modi
115.article_body: PM Narendra Modi said 'Project Cheetah', under which Centre reintroduced cheetahs in the country, is government's endeavour towards wildlife and environment conservation. "Today the cheetah has returned to the soil of India. Along with these cheetahs, the nature-loving consciousness of India has also been awakened," he added. The cheetahs were introduced in MP's Kuno National Park on Saturday.

116.title: 50-year-old man who murdered intoxicated man in Delhi 25 years ago held
116.article_body: The Delhi Police have arrested a 50-year-old man for allegedly murdering another man 25 years ago. Reports said that the accused, Ramu, murdered the victim, Kishan Lal, at a party when the latter was intoxicated. Lal's wife helped the police in tracing Ramu's family and later also helped identify Ramu, police said.

117.title: India's forex reserves drop to $550 bn, lowest in nearly 2 years
117.article_body: India's foreign exchange reserves fell to their lowest level in nearly two years, the Reserve Bank of India data showed. The reserves fell by $2.234 billion to $550.87 billion as of September 9. This is the sixth weekly fall in the country's forex reserves, which have declined by almost $80 billion since the start of the Russia-Ukraine war in February.

118.title: Guj bus catches fire after malfunction in system, 15-20 passengers evacuated
118.article_body: A bus caught fire after a reported malfunction in the system in Gujarat's Ahmedabad, reports said. "Initially there was smoke, which the driver smelled. But there was no BRTS station nearby when the smoke was sensed by the bus driver," an official said, adding that there were about 15 to 20 passengers in the bus. The passengers were evacuated.

119.title: Pune-based group to stage protest over ban on cyclists at SPPU
119.article_body: A Pune-based non-profit organisation, Indo Athletic Society, will stage a protest at the main gate of Savitribai Phule Pune University (SPPU) against a ban on cyclists on campus on Saturday. The group's head said that the ban has been in place since a month and added, "We question this unfairness towards cyclists while two- and four-wheelers are allowed on...campus."

120.title: India's growth to be sustained in months ahead: Finance Ministry report
120.article_body: Amid a revival in employment numbers and a rebound in private consumption, India's economic growth is likely to be sustained in the coming months, Finance Ministry's Department of Economic Affairs report said. Inflationary pressures are also likely to subside with easing of external pressure. Real GDP in Q1 FY23 is nearly 4% ahead of its corresponding 2019-20 level, it added.

121.title: MobiKwik appoints Mukul Saxena as CEO for payment gateway Zaakpay
121.article_body: Sequoia Capital-backed MobiKwik has named Mukul Saxena as the CEO of its financial services and payment gateway platform Zaakpay. Saxena, who has over 20-year experience in the business, formerly served as Executive Vice President and Director of IndusInd Bank's payments department. MobiKwik was founded by Bipin Preet Singh and Upasana Taku in 2009 and became a unicorn in October 2021.

122.title: Don't rename AIIMS Delhi: Faculty body writes to Health Minister
122.article_body: The Faculty Association of AIIMS (FAIMS) has written a letter to Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya urging him to not change the name of AIIMS Delhi. The association said it would lead to a loss of the institute's identity. "That is why famous and established institutes have the same names for centuries - Oxford, Cambridge and Harvard universities," it said.

123.title: Figma founder, who's a college dropout, to get $2 billion after selling startup to Adobe
123.article_body: Figma founder Dylan Field's stake in the online design startup will be valued at more than $2 billion after its $20-billion sale to Adobe. Field dropped out of an Ivy League school in 2012 to accept a $100,000 grant from billionaire Peter Thiel to start Figma. With this, Field has also become the wealthiest person to go through Thiel Fellowship.

124.title: IFS officer's Twitter thread on what led to extinction of cheetahs in India goes viral
124.article_body: With India reintroducing cheetahs after declaring the species extinct domestically over 70 years ago, IFS officer Parveen Kaswan's Twitter thread on what led to their extinction went viral. Sharing archival footage, Kaswan explained how cheetahs were domesticated and used by hunting parties. He also shared a picture, showing "last lot" of cheetahs being hunted by King of Koriya in 1947.

125.title: I thought I was God, loved women too much: Ex-Madrid player Royston
125.article_body: Discussing his failure at Real Madrid, the club's ex-footballer Royston Drenthe said, "I wasn't ready to be a pro. I thought I was God, loved women and...partying too much and you can't combine that with football." "When you are 20 years old and nobody has ever taught you how to act, it becomes difficult to learn," added Royston.

126.title: 292 cases against Ola, Uber in Bengaluru over charging high fares: Report
126.article_body: The Karnataka Transport Department has filed 292 cases against Ola, Uber and other such companies for charging high fares in Bengaluru, reports said. Reports added that several commuters had made complaints about the same. Some commuters had also sent their complaints via email to state Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai and other top officials.

127.title: Musk demands testimony of Twitter's ex-product chief in takeover dispute
127.article_body: Elon Musk has demanded Twitter make Kayvon Beykpour, the firm's ex-head of consumer unit, testify about spam accounts in $44 billion Twitter takeover dispute. Beykpour's lawyers recently said he's "beyond the subpoena power" of US courts as he's currently outside US. However, Musk's legal team in a filing said, "Beykpour is within Twitter's control and [it] must produce...[him] for deposition."

128.title: 'Tamasha' orchestrated by PM: Congress on return of cheetahs
128.article_body: In a bid to assert that the "cheetah project" began during UPA years, Congress leader and former Union Minister Jairam Ramesh shared a picture from his 2010 South Africa visit, showing him with a cheetah. "The 'tamasha' orchestrated by PM [Narendra Modi] today is unwarranted and is yet another diversion from pressing national issues," he said after cheetahs reached India.

129.title: Upset over a dish that her mom made for dinner, Dehradun girl kills self
129.article_body: A 16-year-old girl allegedly died by suicide after having an argument with her mother over a dish prepared for dinner in Dehradun. The girl reportedly expressed displeasure over the dish cooked by her mother and refused to have dinner. She then locked herself in her room. Family members broke the door open when she did not respond after some time.

130.title: Denmark's ex-spy chief charged with leaking 'highly classified' info
130.article_body: Denmark's former foreign intelligence chief was formally charged on Friday with leaking "highly classified information". Lars Findsen, who was in the post from 2015 until his abrupt suspension in 2020, is accused of passing state secrets to six people including two journalists. Findsen was held in custody from December 2021 to February 2022 while under investigation.

131.title: Coordination between Rohit, Dravid in front of media important: Ajay Jadeja
131.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Ajay Jadeja said it's important for India captain Rohit Sharma and head coach Rahul Dravid to have "coordination" in front of media. "There shouldn't be...confusion over team combinations. There shouldn't be statements about 'trying out things'...These are players and they have families," added Ajay. "When they read them, such things do pop up at a certain...time," he stated.

132.title: Harbinger of achhe din: Anil, Kangana wish PM Modi on his birthday
132.article_body: Bollywood celebrities like Anil Kapoor, Kangana Ranaut and Akshay Kumar took to social media to wish Prime Minister Narendra Modi on his birthday. Anil tweeted, "A very Happy Birthday to the man who...put India on the world map...The harbinger of achhe din." Kangana wrote, "From selling tea...as a child to becoming the most powerful man on...planet...Nothing can erase your legacy."

133.title: Gujarat is no Pakistan: Fadnavis on Maharashtra losing Vedanta project
133.article_body: After Gujarat bagged the Vedanta-Foxconn project, Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis said the neighbouring state was "no Pakistan". "It's our brother," Fadnavis added. He further criticised the previous Uddhav Thackeray-led government for losing the deal, claiming 10% commission had to be paid for availing of any subsidy when MVA government was in power but Gujarat surged ahead at that time.

134.title: Statement was provocative: Ramiz Raja on video of him grabbing Indian reporter's phone
134.article_body: Reacting to a video that showed him getting angry at an Indian reporter and grabbing his phone after Pakistan's loss at Asia Cup final, PCB chief Ramiz Raja said the reporter's statement was "provocative". "The reporter said all Pakistani fans are angry with the loss...I just asked him how he'd know that. You're staying in a different area," Raja added.

135.title: UP appoints retired IAS officer Awanish Kumar Awasthi as adviser to CM
135.article_body: Uttar Pradesh government on Friday appointed retired IAS officer Awanish Kumar Awasthi as an adviser to Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath. A temporary post of adviser to the CM has been created till February 28, 2023, to give advice to CM in connection with administrative work, a government order said. Awasthi was the Additional Chief Secretary (Home) in the UP government.

136.title: Our next film together will be Brahmāstra 2: Alia-Ranbir on rumours of rom-com
136.article_body: Speaking about rumours of featuring in a romantic-comedy film together, actors Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor have stated that their next film together will be 'Brahmāstra: Part Two – Dev'. "Ayan is so protective of me and Ranbir together that I don't know if he will let us do anything apart from the 'Brahmāstra' films," Alia added.

137.title: Pietersen reacts to BJP's tweet on wildlife conservation in Hindi, calls PM 'badhiya aadmi'
137.article_body: After BJP shared a tweet about India recording a substantial rise in the number of wildlife species under PM Narendra Modi's government, South Africa-born ex-England cricketer Kevin Pietersen reacted to the post in Hindi. He thanked PM Modi for his "continued efforts" in supporting wildlife conservation in India. Calling him "badhiya aadmi", Pietersen wrote, "All leaders should follow your lead."

138.title: 'Playboy jobs, male escort jobs' posters seen at Uttarakhand police station
138.article_body: An investigation has been launched by Pauri Garhwal police after posters reading "Playboy jobs, male escort jobs" were put up in Uttarakhand's Kotdwar city. The posters were pasted on walls at Kotdwar bus station, railway station, almost all major squares and even in the office premises of the circle officer of Kotdwar police and the city police station.

139.title: 19-yr-old man flashes private parts, sexually assaults women in queue to see Queen's coffin
139.article_body: A 19-year-old man allegedly flashed his private parts and sexually assaulted at least two women standing in queue to see Queen Elizabeth II's coffin in London. The man, identified as Adio Adeshine, later jumped into the River Thames in an attempt to evade police officers before coming out and being arrested.

140.title: Jadeja's absence will be a massive loss for India in T20 WC: Jayawardena
140.article_body: Former Sri Lanka captain Mahela Jayawardena said the unavailability of all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja for the T20 World Cup 2022 will be a "massive loss" for Team India, considering his form. "It is a tough one for them and probably a concern not having that left-hander. They have switched to leaving out Dinesh Karthik and bringing in Rishabh Pant," added Jayawardena.

141.title: Urban Company's FY22 loss widens to ₹514.14 crore, revenue up 75%
141.article_body: Tiger Global-backed app-based home services marketplace Urban Company reported a consolidated net loss of ₹514.14 crore during FY22 as against ₹249.28 crore loss in FY21. Its revenue during FY22 was up over 75% to ₹509.17 crore as against ₹289.78 crore the preceding fiscal. The Gurugram-based company was founded by Abhiraj Singh Bhal, Varun Khaitan and Raghav Chandra in 2014.

142.title: High tide of 3.12 metres expected in Mumbai at 3:46 pm today, BMC shares post
142.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) took to Twitter to update the city residents about high tide and low tide in Mumbai. In its post, BMC said that there will be a high tide of 3.12 metres at 3:46 pm today. Meanwhile, the low tide is likely to take place at around 9.46 pm with a height of 1.63 metres.

143.title: 14 killed, 10 missing as heavy rains trigger landslides in Nepal
143.article_body: Landslides in Nepal triggered by heavy rains have killed 14 people while 10 others have gone missing, officials said. Home Minister Bal Krishna Khand has ordered the deployment of helicopters for search and rescue operations. As per the official data, at least 48 people have been killed across the country in flash floods and landslides so far this year.

144.title: 16-yr-old missing girl's body recovered from sugarcane field in Assam
144.article_body: The body of a 16-year-old girl, who went missing on September 13, was recovered from a sugarcane field in Assam's Karbi Anglong district on Friday. "A local youth found a pit in the...field when he went to cut...grass there. When we started digging...we recovered a dead body," police said. The deceased's father is suspected to be accused in the case.

145.title: 4 people die of suffocation inside an old well in Andhra Pradesh
145.article_body: Four people, including a father-son duo, died of suffocation inside an old well in Andhra Pradesh's Krishna on Friday, police said. After the father died of suffocation when he went inside the well, the son entered it to save him, but he too died. The other two persons entered the well to rescue the father-son duo, but they too died.

146.title: India Inc's overseas direct investment falls 59% in Aug: RBI data
146.article_body: India Inc's investment in overseas ventures fell by 59% to $1.03 billion on an annual basis in August this year, RBI data showed. Total financial commitment by the domestic firms was worth $1,027.67 million in August 2022-23 as against $2,500.97 million in the corresponding month in 2021-22. Of the total investment, the highest was in the form of equity infusion.

147.title: Actor Sivakarthikeyan criticised for racist comment, says 'All Korean actors look alike'
147.article_body: Actor Sivakarthikeyan, known for films like Remo and Doctor, is being criticised on social media over his racist comments on Korean people. While speaking at a school's cultural event in Tamil Nadu, Sivakarthikeyan said, "Whenever I see Korean films, I feel like all the actors in them are the same."

148.title: 3rd elephant found dead in 3 months in Jharkhand, tusks missing
148.article_body: A 12-year-old elephant was found dead in a forest in Jharkhand's Ramgarh district, an official said on Saturday. "We found that [the] two tusks of the dead elephant [were] missing. It seems they were chopped off," Mandu Forest Range Officer Suresh Ram said. This is the third elephant carcass to be found in the state in three months.

149.title: A character is like scar on soul: Kangana pens note amid 'Emergency' shoot
149.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut on Saturday took to Instagram to pen a note on identity crisis amid the shoot of her second directorial 'Emergency'. She wrote, "You dissolve in the character...nothing of you is left in you. You see your own pictures like a stranger...once a character has happened to you it remains like a scar on the soul."

150.title: Uber staff reacted to hacker's post on internal chat with emoji, screenshot surfaces
150.article_body: A screenshot showing Uber employees' reaction to an alleged teen hacker announcing on the company's internal chat that Uber has suffered a breach has surfaced online. The screenshot shows employees reacting to the post with lighthearted emoji like sirens and popcorn and GIFs. Many employees appeared to have initially thought it was a joke and even interacted with the hacker.

151.title: For decades no effort was made to rehabilitate cheetahs: PM Modi
151.article_body: PM Narendra Modi has said that it's unfortunate that cheetahs were declared extinct in India in 1952, "but for decades no meaningful effort was made to rehabilitate them". This comes as PM Modi released eight cheetahs from Namibia at Madhya Pradesh's Kuno National Park on the occasion of his birthday today. "Today, the country has started rehabilitating cheetahs," he added.

152.title: Funnel cloud forms over Disney World in US; video goes viral
152.article_body: A large funnel-shaped cloud formation was seen over the Walt Disney World Florida, US. Commenting on the video shared by a Twitter user, people speculated that the cloud was a tornado. However, the US National Weather Service (NWS) later tweeted, "Looks like it could be a funnel cloud, hard to tell if there is any rotation in the video though."

153.title: Couldn't speak Hindi, wasn't a B'wood buff before acting: Alaya F
153.article_body: Actress Alaya F revealed that she could not speak Hindi, could not dance and was not a Bollywood buff before becoming an actor. She further said her mother Pooja Bedi and grandfather Kabir Bedi would have advised her not to become an actor. "But I'm someone if I set my mind on something, I'll do it to death," she added.

154.title: I was so intimidated on the first day I met Mr Bachchan: Rashmika
154.article_body: Speaking about her first meeting with veteran actor Amitabh Bachchan, actress Rashmika Mandanna said that she was "so intimidated because of his whole aura". She added, "I'm glad I got to do my first proper Hindi film with Bachchan sir. He's the best teacher of them all." The two will be seen as a father-daughter duo in 'Goodbye'.

155.title: CCTV shows no leopard even as Gurugram people claim sightings, cages set up
155.article_body: Despite several residents of Gurugram's DLF Phase 5 claiming to have sighted a leopard in the locality, wildlife officials have said that nothing of the sort has been captured on CCTV. Team also found no pug marks in the area. However, wildlife officials have set up two cages in the area to trap the leopard in case there is one.

156.title: Nora Fatehi's brother-in-law received BMW worth ₹65 lakh from conman Sukesh: Reports
156.article_body: Actress-dancer Nora Fatehi's brother-in-law, Bobby, received BMW worth ₹65 lakh from conman Sukesh Chandrasekhar as a gift, according to reports. Bobby and Sukesh's aide Pinki Irani were reportedly cross-examined together by Delhi Police's Economic Offences Wing. Nora reportedly told the officials that she never met Sukesh in person and was in touch with him through WhatsApp.

157.title: Stalin, a mere doll; power is with his family: AIADMK leader Palaniswami
157.article_body: AIADMK interim chief Edappadi K Palaniswami (EPS) on Friday termed the DMK government in Tamil Nadu a family regime. "In Tamil Nadu there are about four Chief Ministers. The family is the power-centre, which wields power. Today, Chief Minister Stalin looks like a doll," Palaniswami alleged. He further claimed that people of the state have only suffered under DMK's rule.

158.title: Flood alert issued in Pune after discharge of water into Mula-Mutha rivers
158.article_body: Pune administration issued a flood alert to citizens residing alongside the Mula-Mutha rivers following the highest discharge of water this year. "The four dams upstream of Mutha...are filled to capacity prompting water to be discharged from all dams- Panshet, Varasgaon, Temghar and Khadakwasla," an official said. The water discharge into Khadakwasla is the highest this year, the official added.

159.title: Railway Minister takes part in 'Swachhata Pakhwada' on PM Modi's birthday
159.article_body: On the occasion of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's 72nd birthday, Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw took part in the 'Swachhata Pakhwada' at Hazrat Nizamuddin railway station in the national capital. "From today, a campaign for cleanliness has started in Indian Railways, post offices, telecom, IT and other departments of the country...Cleanliness is a great synonym for service," said Vaishnaw.

160.title: 'Laal...' isn't a short-term film that can be hit or flop: Mona Singh
160.article_body: Actress Mona Singh, who portrays the mother of Aamir Khan's character in 'Laal Singh Chaddha', stated that the film is not "a short-term film" that can be labelled a hit or flop. She added, "It will stay with people for a long time." 'Laal Singh Chaddha' was made on a ₹180 crore budget and collected around ₹130 crore worldwide.

161.title: Kartik knows exactly what audience likes, no wonder he's successful: Alaya F
161.article_body: Actress Alaya F said that actor Kartik Aaryan knows exactly what the audience likes, adding that it's no wonder he is as successful as he is. The two will be seen together in the upcoming film 'Freddy'. "Shooting...with Kartik was wonderful, he is actually a really really talented guy, he is so good at what he does," the actress added.

162.title: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut played a major role in Patra Chawl scam: ED
162.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate opposed Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut's bail plea in the special PMLA court and claimed that Raut played a major role in laundering money in the Patra Chawl scam. "In order to avoid trial, Sanjay Raut has been operating behind the curtains with his confidant Pravin Raut as his frontman," said ED.

163.title: Johnny Depp-Amber Heard trial adapted into film, releases on Sep 30
163.article_body: The defamation trial between actors Johnny Depp and Amber Heard has been adapted into a film titled 'Hot Take: The Depp/Heard Trial' and will release on an OTT platform on September 30. The film features Mark Hapka as Depp and Megan Davis as Heard. Actresses Melissa Marty and Mary Carrig will portray the lawyers Camille Vasquez and Elaine Bredehoft, respectively.

164.title: Will not give authority to Kerala govt to appoint vice-chancellors: Guv
164.article_body: Commenting on the University Laws Amendment Bill, Kerala Governor Arif Mohammed Khan said that he will not give the authority to the state government to appoint vice-chancellors. "I am saying it clearly, this will amount to executive interference," he added. All the appointments in the universities will be made on the basis of merit, Governor Khan further said.

165.title: E-auction of over 1,200 mementos, gifts given to PM Modi begins
165.article_body: A 16-day e-auction of over 1,200 mementos and gifts given to PM Narendra Modi began on Saturday. The Ministry of Culture invited people to participate in the e-auction, which will continue till October 2, through pmmementos.gov.in. The items have been put on display at the National Gallery of Modern Art (NGMA) in New Delhi.

166.title: Lebanese banks to shut after string of hold-ups amid economic crisis
166.article_body: Banks in Lebanon will close for three days next week following a string of raids by customers demanding access to their frozen savings. As many as seven banks have been held up since Wednesday. Lebanon is in a severe economic crisis and the banks in the country have been applying strict withdrawal limits on foreign currency assets since 2019.

167.title: Duo shoot cab driver dead, run away with cab in Gurugram; arrested
167.article_body: Two persons were arrested after they allegedly booked a cab, shot the driver dead in Gurugram's Pataudi and then ran away with the vehicle. "The suspects booked a cab for Delhi with...intention to steal it and flee to a hill station," ACP Crime-I Preet Pal said. The accused ran out of fuel in Nuh and abandoned the cab, police said.

168.title: FedEx shares post biggest 1-day drop in over 40 years, wiping out $11 billion
168.article_body: Shares of FedEx plunged more than 21% on Friday, marking the biggest one-day drop in the company's stock since at least 1980. FedEx lost $11 billion in market value, wiping out two years of stock gains. The decline in its stock was triggered after FedEx withdrew its earnings forecast and announced cost-cutting measures, including closure of 90 office locations.

169.title: India have taken a risk by picking only 4 pacers for T20 WC: Johnson
169.article_body: Ex-Australia pacer Mitchell Johnson said Team India have taken a "risk" by picking only four pacers in their squad for T20 World Cup 2022. "In Australia, you surely need to play three pacers, possibly four in certain conditions, for example, Perth," added Johnson. "The main thing in Australia is the extra bounce and pace and adjusting your length," he stated.

170.title: Video shows PM Modi clicking photos of cheetahs after releasing them in MP
170.article_body: PM Narendra Modi could be seen clicking photos of the cheetahs he released in Madhya Pradesh's Kuno National Park on his birthday on Saturday. CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan also accompanied him to the site. Eight cheetahs have been brought to India from Namibia through a special chartered cargo flight that landed on Saturday morning.

171.title: Man breaks queue and runs towards Queen's coffin; pics surface
171.article_body: Pictures showing a man breaking queue and running towards Queen's coffin have surfaced on social media. The man has been arrested after he approached the coffin at Westminster Hall on Friday. The live video feed of the Queen lying in state cut away for a brief period during the incident.

172.title: Karnataka CM distributes electric 2-wheelers to sanitation workers
172.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Friday distributed electric two-wheelers to sanitation workers who are working at the Vidhana Soudha, Vikasa Soudha and MS Buildings in Bengaluru. He said that the sanitation workers "move in cars in Western countries and now the same thing is happening here". The scheme has been extended to ten municipal corporations across the state, he added.

173.title: Rise of ISIS, al-Qaeda in Afghanistan puts world in grave danger: Ex-US NSA
173.article_body: Former US National Security Advisor (NSA) John Bolton said the rapid rise of ISIS, al-Qaeda terrorist network in Afghanistan has put not only Afghanistan but the rest of the world in "grave danger". Bolton also accused the Taliban government of having ties with international terrorist groups and failing to comply with the provisions of the Doha Agreement to battle terrorism.

174.title: Don't use violent measures to tackle stray dogs: Kerala CM urges people
174.article_body: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan on Friday urged the people not to resort to violent measures to deal with the stray dog menace in the state.
