Beating, poisoning and tying up dogs on streets will not solve the problem, CM Vijayan said, adding, "Indulging in such acts is unacceptable." This comes amid reports of rising attacks by dogs in the state.

175.title: AAP MLA Amanatullah Khan's business partner arrested under Arms Act
175.article_body: Delhi AAP MLA Amanatullah Khan's business partner Hamid Ali has been arrested under Arms Act. This comes after the Delhi Police's Anti-Corruption Branch (ACB) on Friday raided his premises, along with that of Khan's, in connection with a two-year-old corruption case involving the Delhi Waqf Board. A pistol, some bullets and ₹12 lakh in cash were recovered from Ali's residence.

176.title: When films don't make revenue, stars always get blamed: Nagarjuna
176.article_body: Actor Nagarjuna has stated that when films don't generate revenue, the stars always get the blame. "The way a film is marketed is...for stars and stardom...That's what you have to be careful of. Right now I've fallen away from that trap," he said. He added that even as a superstar, he wants fans to appreciate his film, efforts and creativity.

177.title: You can't ignore women anymore, there's no excuse: FM to companies
177.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said companies need to hire more women in leadership positions and also widen the female directors' base. She said women aren't asking for gender parity and inclusivity but if "you want profit, get us in". "There is just no excuse...you cannot ignore us anymore," Sitharaman added. The average number of women on Indian boards is 1.03.

178.title: PM Modi releases 8 cheetahs from Namibia at Kuno National Park on his birthday
178.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi released eight cheetahs brought from Namibia at the Kuno National Park in MP on his birthday on Saturday. The cheetahs were brought in a special plane that landed in Gwalior. The cheetahs were flown from southern Africa for their reintroduction in India seven decades after the species was declared extinct in the country in 1952.

179.title: Congress to launch 800 km 'Bharat Jodo Yatra - Assam': Jairam Ramesh
179.article_body: The Congress party will launch the Assam version of its Bharat Jodo Yatra on November 1. The party will cover about 800 km from Dhubri to Sadiya as part of 'Bharat Jodo Yatra - Assam', senior party leader Jairam Ramesh tweeted on Friday. "The country is facing tremendous economic inequality, social polarisation and centralisation of power," he said in Guwahati.

180.title: India's current account deficit may remain within 3% of GDP: RBI
180.article_body: India's current account deficit (CAD) may remain within 3% of the GDP in 2022-23 as against 1.2% during the last fiscal, RBI's bulletin said. India's trade deficit during the first five months of FY23 widened to $124.5 billion from $54 billion in the previous corresponding period. The CAD is an important indicator of the balance of payments of a country.

181.title: Warne was better than me, I learnt things from him: Muralitharan
181.article_body: Sri Lankan legend Muttiah Muralitharan said late Australian cricketer Shane Warne was "better" than him. "I looked up to him and learnt things from him. We all miss him," added Muralitharan. "If he had...played the same as me...he would have got more wickets than me...What he has done for spin bowling is more than anyone," Muralitharan had earlier stated.

182.title: AAP backs MLA arrested in corruption case, calls case 'outright fake'
182.article_body: AAP defended MLA Amanatullah Khan, who was arrested on Friday in connection with irregularities in Delhi Waqf Board recruitment and called the case baseless and outright fake. The party said, "Nothing was found from his residence or office during the raid. This is a new conspiracy to implicate the MLA in a false case and defame the AAP."

183.title: Govt cuts windfall tax on domestic crude oil, ATF, diesel export
183.article_body: The government reduced the windfall tax on domestically produced crude oil to ₹10,500 from ₹13,300 a tonne, according to a Ministry of Finance circular. It also reduced the tax on the export of diesel to ₹8.5 per litre from ₹13.5 and on aviation turbine fuel (ATF) from ₹9 per litre to ₹5. The new rates will be effective from Saturday.

184.title: Kerala HC upholds beedi tycoon's life term for security guard's murder
184.article_body: Kerala High Court has upheld 'beedi' tycoon Mohammed Nisham's life imprisonment. Nisham, in 2016, was given a life sentence by a Thrissur court for a security guard's murder in January 2015. The incident happened when Nisham was returning from a party to his apartment in his SUV and he attacked the guard over a delay in opening the gate.

185.title: Ayan Mukerji to make separate films on 'Jalastra', 'Vanarastra': Report
185.article_body: Following the success of 'Brahmāstra: Part One – Shiva', filmmaker Ayan Mukerji is set to make separate films on 'Jalastra' and 'Vanarastra', as per reports. The spin-off films will reportedly explore the origin of the astras and feature Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt. Ayan said earlier that he is already thinking about an origin story for Shah Rukh Khan's character.

186.title: Sus-Pashan bridge officially opens for public in Pune
186.article_body: The Sus-Pashan bridge in Pune was officially opened for the public in the presence of Maharashtra minister Chandrakant Patil and Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) officers on Friday. The construction work for the bridge, which was built at a cost of ₹41 crore, was started in 2020. PMC Additional Municipal Commissioner (Estate) Kunal Khemnar said, "We've completed...bridge well before its deadline."

187.title: Over 100 mangroves in Navi Mumbai destroyed, FIR registered
187.article_body: The Navi Mumbai unit of the forest department registered a case against a Karanjade resident for destroying around 100 mangroves in Vaghivali village of Panvel. The FIR was filed after a site visit on August 18, 2022. According to the complaint, the man, identified as Kundan Vilash Bhoir, created a fishing pond by building an earthen embankment, killing 100-125 mangroves.

188.title: Leonardo is a big 'Squid Game' fan, we can ask him to join: Director
188.article_body: Korean drama show 'Squid Game' director-writer Hwang Dong-hyuk was recently asked if any Hollywood celebrities will be a part of the second season. He said, "That's not in the plan and if the stage changes, maybe in Season 3...Leonardo DiCaprio did say he's a big fan of 'Squid Game' so maybe...we can ask him to join the games."

189.title: I'll take all reviews into consideration before Brahmāstra 2: Ayan
189.article_body: Filmmaker Ayan Mukerji has stated that he is happy with the performance of his film 'Brahmāstra: Part One – Shiva' at the box office. "I haven't been able to absorb all those reviews, be it negative reviews, fan theories or what people did not like...I will take all that into consideration before moving on to part two," the filmmaker said.

190.title: Amit Shah extends birthday wishes to PM Modi, calls him ‘most beloved leader’
190.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah wished Prime Minister Narendra Modi on his birthday and called him the "most beloved leader". He also lauded the PM's efforts in making impossible tasks possible with his "India-first" thinking and determination for the welfare of the poor. "I pray to God for his good health and long life," said Shah.

191.title: Gautam Adani appointed Chairman of Ambuja Cements, son Karan to head ACC
191.article_body: Gautam Adani has been appointed as the Chairman of Ambuja Cements, while his elder son Karan has been named ACC Chairman. Karan, who also serves as Adani Ports and SEZ CEO, has been appointed as Director of both cement companies. Notably, Adani Group has become the second-largest cement maker in the country after acquiring the cement business from Switzerland-based Holcim.

192.title: Arrested TMC leader’s Birbhum house raided in cattle smuggling case
192.article_body: The CBI raided TMC leader Anubrata Mondal’s Birbhum house in connection with the cattle smuggling case. The CBI officials also questioned his daughter Sukanya. She is allegedly a shareholder in the rice mill associated with her father. The TMC leader was arrested in August and then later sent to 14-day judicial custody by the CBI Special Court.

193.title: Casting couch not limited to Bollywood, happens everywhere: Shama
193.article_body: Television actress Shama Sikander has stated that casting couch is not limited to Bollywood alone, adding that it happens everywhere. "Some of these producers and makers were well-established names in the industry," she added. Shama further called "the whole concept of asking for sex in return for work" the lowest of low, adding that they are terribly insecure human beings.

194.title: No evidence that sensitive user data was stolen: Uber on latest hack
194.article_body: Uber said it has found "no evidence" that sensitive user data was compromised in a breach of its internal computer systems. A reportedly 18-year-old hacker gained access to an employee's Slack account on Thursday and posted a message saying, "Uber has suffered a data breach." Uber said internal software tools that it took down after the hack are being restored.

195.title: 8 from Ludhiana, including 2 Cong councillors & ex-SAD councillor, join AAP
195.article_body: As many as eight leaders from Ludhiana, including two Congress councillors Amrit Varsha Rampal and Kala Gautam, joined AAP on Friday. Former two-time SAD councillor Tanvir Singh Dhaliwal also joined AAP in presence of the party's state general secretary Harchand Singh Barsat and Ludhiana west MLA Gurpreet Gogi. Former Congress councillor Satwinder Singh Jabaddi was also inducted into AAP.

196.title: Just because a film is loved, you can't milk it: Dulquer on remakes
196.article_body: Speaking about remakes and sequels of classic films, actor Dulquer Salmaan said that just because a film is loved and has done well doesn't mean you can milk it. "Every time we love a classic film, I don't think you should do a sequel or do anything...It is like the golden egg story. You can't kill the goose," he added.

197.title: Am I needed to weaken Congress, isn't Rahul Gandhi enough: Kejriwal
197.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Friday rejected allegations that he was acting as a 'B-team' of the BJP and weakening the Congress. "Am I needed to weaken the Congress? Isn't Rahul Gandhi enough," said Kejriwal. Asked about efforts to form a grand Opposition alliance, he said, "I am not against anybody. But I don't understand this politics of alliance."

198.title: Police wait for thieves as they run after robbing Delhi man, arrest them
198.article_body: Two thieves were arrested after they stole cash and jewellery worth over ₹5 lakh from the house of a 67-year-old man in Delhi. The police officials were reportedly waiting a few metres from the building to arrest the robbers after having tracked them down in connection with a past theft case. Reports said that shots were fired from both sides.

199.title: There's only one SRK: Dulquer on comparison between 'Veer-Zaara', 'Sita Ramam'
199.article_body: Speaking about the comparison between 'Veer-Zaara' and 'Sita Ramam', actor Dulquer Salmaan said that comparing him with Shah Rukh Khan is insulting to the latter, adding, "There is only one Shah Rukh Khan." Dulquer further said, "He is such a model for all of us to follow. How he treats people, how he talks to them...He is very special."

200.title: Police seize 1.4 kg heroin worth ₹7 crore in Gurugram, 2 arrested
200.article_body: Gurugram Police recovered 1.4 kg of heroin worth ₹7 crore from an apartment in Sector-12 on Sheetla Mata Road on Friday. Two men, including an Afghan national, were arrested in connection with the case. According to police, the contraband was found concealed in pouches hidden in the apartment. The suspects received the drugs from their associates in Afghanistan, police added.

201.title: India votes in favour of Ukraine Prez addressing UNGA virtually
201.article_body: India was among the 101 countries that voted on Friday in favour of allowing Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy to address the high-level UN General Assembly (UNGA) session next week. A total of seven nations voted against it. Meanwhile, the 193-member assembly has rejected an amendment proposed by Belarus to allow any leader facing exceptional difficulties to deliver a pre-recorded address.

202.title: Get price drops on Samsung Galaxy S22 Plus, S21 FE and more: Flipkart
202.article_body: Flipkart revealed that as part of Big Billion Days sale, Samsung Galaxy S22 Plus and Galaxy S21 FE are priced at ₹59,999* and ₹31,999* respectively, with a 30% and 50% discount on their current selling prices. Galaxy S22 Plus will be available for purchase right away through Flipkart's 'Sale Price Live' program. Flipkart Big Billion Days starts from September 23.

203.title: A human tragedy has occurred: Mahindra CEO after woman killed by loan recovery agent
203.article_body: Mahindra Group CEO Anish Shah has issued a statement after a pregnant woman in Jharkhand was mowed to death by a loan recovery agent forcibly driving a tractor away. "We are deeply saddened and disturbed...A human tragedy has occurred," wrote Shah. The company will investigate the incident and review the practice of using third-party collection agencies, the CEO further said.

204.title: How can she be innocent yet portray seduction, uff: Kangana on Sridevi
204.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut on Friday took to Instagram Stories to share a clip of late veteran actress Sridevi's song 'Kate Nahin Kat Te' from the 1987 film 'Mr. India'. The actress wrote alongside the clip, "It is beyond me how anyone can be childlike innocent/funny and yet portray intoxicating feminine seduction...Ufff...I am Sridevi Ji's biggest fan. Legend."

205.title: More nervous than I was on int'l debut: Gambhir on playing Legends League Cricket
205.article_body: Ex-India opener Gautam Gambhir said he's "way more nervous" about playing in Legends League Cricket 2022 than he was when he made his international debut. "I have not played cricket for a very long time," added Gambhir. Gambhir will be leading India Capitals. "Captaincy will always be challenging for...me...[I]...[expect] a lot from myself and the other players," he stated.

206.title: Charminar, Golconda Fort lit up in Tricolour for Hyd Liberation Day
206.article_body: Hyderabad's iconic monuments Charminar and Golconda Fort were lit up in Tricolour on Friday night on the eve of 75th Hyderabad Liberation Day. A year-long celebration has been planned to mark the liberation of the state of Hyderabad. Union Culture Minister G Kishan Reddy tweeted images of the two monuments. He also shared an anthem to commemorate Hyderabad Liberation Day.

207.title: Biggest wildlife incident of this century: MP CM on cheetahs' arrival
207.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan has said that the arrival of eight cheetahs in the state from Namibia today is the "biggest wildlife incident of this century". Adding that there's "no greater gift" for the state than the cheetahs' arrival in Kuno National Park, he further said, "[Cheetahs] had gone extinct and it's a historic step to reintroduce them."

208.title: Meghalaya stops plans to open casinos amid resistance from Church
208.article_body: Meghalaya government has decided to stop its plans to establish casinos in the state following resistance from the Church and social organisations. Earlier, the state government had given provisional licences to three firms for opening casinos in a bid to boost tourism and revenue. The provisional licences will "lapse automatically" if the process doesn't start, state CM Conrad Sangma said.

209.title: Special chartered flight carrying 8 cheetahs from Namibia lands in Gwalior
209.article_body: The special chartered cargo flight bringing eight cheetahs from Namibia landed at the Indian Air Force Station in Madhya Pradesh's Gwalior on Saturday. After all necessary formalities, including paperwork, at Gwalior, the cheetahs will be flown to Palpur village in two helicopters, an official said. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will release the cheetahs into Kuno National Park in MP today.

210.title: J&J's baby powder production licence cancelled in Maharashtra, recall ordered
210.article_body: The Maharashtra government has cancelled the manufacturing licence of Johnson & Johnson's baby powder with immediate effect after it found a sample drawn for inspection to be of sub-standard quality. The use of the product may affect the health of new-born babies' skin, Maharashtra FDA said. It has further ordered Johnson & Johnson to recall the powder from the market.

211.title: 22-yr-old 'beaten to death' by Iran police over improper hijab; actress Remini shares pic
211.article_body: A 22-year-old woman has died in an Iranian hospital days after being detained by police over 'improper hijab'. Witnesses reported that Mahsa Amini was beaten in a police van, while the police denied the allegations. American actress Leah Remini shared a picture of the victim and tweeted, "Her mother said, 'Let the world know they killed my daughter.'"

212.title: Adani Group overtakes Tata Group as India's largest business house
212.article_body: Adani Group, led by the world's second richest person Gautam Adani, has become India's largest business house with a total market capitalisation of ₹20.74 lakh crore. The conglomerate overtook Tata Group which holds a combined market value of ₹20.7 lakh crore as of Friday. Notably, Adani Group added ₹18.7 lakh crore to its market value in less than three years.

213.title: ‘Liberation’ is a wrong word: Owaisi on Hyderabad National Liberation Day
213.article_body: Reacting to Hyderabad Liberation Day, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said that the word "liberation" is wrong as Hyderabad will always remain an integral part of India. Earlier, Owaisi had written a letter to Union Home Minister Amit Shah and Telangana CM KCR, seeking the renaming of Hyderabad Liberation Day to National Integration Day.

214.title: India reports 5,747 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 46,848
214.article_body: India has reported 5,747 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The data showed that 5,618 people recovered in the last 24 hours following which the active COVID-19 cases in the country dropped to 46,848. This comes a day after 6,298 new COVID-19 cases were reported in India.

215.title: Pics show 8 cheetahs from Namibia being unloaded from special plane in Gwalior
215.article_body: Union Minister for Civil Aviation Jyotiraditya Scindia shared pictures showing eight cheetahs from Namibia being unloaded from the special plane at Gwalior airport. The cheetahs will be transported in helicopters to the Kuno National Park in Sheopur district of Madhya Pradesh. "This is the biggest wildlife incident of this century. This will rapidly boost tourism," MP CM Shivraj Chouhan said.

216.title: How did the US media praise PM Modi for telling Putin it's not the time for war?
216.article_body: The mainstream American media praised PM Narendra Modi for telling Russian President Vladimir Putin that this is not the time for war in Ukraine. "Modi rebukes Putin over war in Ukraine," The Washington Post wrote. "India's Leader Tells Putin That Now Is Not an Era for War," The New York Times said in its headline.

217.title: How did the US media praise PM Modi for telling Putin it's not the time for war?
217.article_body: The mainstream American media praised PM Narendra Modi for telling Russian President Vladimir Putin that this is not the time for war in Ukraine. "Modi rebukes Putin over war in Ukraine," The Washington Post wrote. "India's Leader Tells Putin That Now Is Not an Era for War," The New York Times said in its headline.

218.title: Man carries gun as he takes kids to Kerala school amid rising attacks by dogs
218.article_body: A video showing a father carrying an air gun while escorting his daughter and a group of children to school in Kerala's Kasaragod amid rising attacks by dogs has surfaced online. He can be heard saying he'd shoot if any dog tries to attack. He told media that it was his responsibility as a father to ensure his children's protection.

219.title: Bengaluru sees dip in new COVID-19 cases with 230 infections
219.article_body: The number of new COVID-19 cases in Bengaluru dropped to 230 on Friday, down from 283 reported a day before, according to BBMP. This takes the cumulative case count to 18,69,754. No new deaths were reported, so the overall toll remained at 16,987. The number of active cases was 2,480, while the infection positivity rate dropped to 2.00%.

220.title: 5 soldiers killed in Israeli strike on Damascus airport: Syria
220.article_body: Five soldiers were killed after Israel carried out an airstrike on Syria's Damascus International Airport and other positions south of the capital, Syria's Defence Ministry said on Saturday. Syria's air defences intercepted the hostile missiles in its airspace and shot some of them down, it added. Israel had reportedly launched missile attacks on Syria's Aleppo airport in the past month.

221.title: 6 JSW plant employees dead, over 20 injured after truck hits bus in Odisha
221.article_body: As many as six JSW plant employees died and over 20 others were injured after a speeding coal-laden truck hit a bus on Odisha's Jharsuguda-Sambalpur Biju Expressway on Friday. "Most employees are severely injured. 10 people have been referred to a hospital in Burla, Sambalpur while 14 are under treatment here," Jharsuguda DSP N Mohapatra said.

222.title: Varanasi nominated as first-ever SCO Tourism and Cultural Capital
222.article_body: The city of Varanasi was nominated as the first-ever Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) Tourism and Cultural Capital for the period of 2022 to 2023 on Friday. This comes as the 22nd SCO Summit was being held in Uzbekistan's Samarkand. "The nomination...will promote tourism, cultural and humanitarian exchanges between India and the SCO member Countries," the Ministry of External Affairs said.

223.title: Pregnant woman dies as loan recovery agent runs tractor over her in Jharkhand
223.article_body: A 27-year-old pregnant woman was crushed to death after a loan recovery agent allegedly ran a tractor over her in Hazaribagh, Jharkhand. The woman's father said he received a message demanding payment of ₹1.3 lakh outstanding dues immediately or the tractor would be taken away. The woman was mowed to death when the agent was trying to confiscate the vehicle.

224.title: Fearing exams, 14-year-old Hyderabad boy runs away from home
224.article_body: A 14-year-old boy from Hyderabad's Chanchalguda allegedly ran away from his home out of fear of the fast-approaching exams. The boy's father filed a missing complaint after which a search was launched. The boy was found by the Hanamkonda Police, said his brother-in-law. The father then headed to Hanamkonda to bring his boy back.

225.title: Mumbai people may have to pay ₹6 lakh for 0001 on car number plate: Maha Dept
225.article_body: A new draft notification by Maharashtra Transport Department said that residents of Mumbai, Thane, Pune and other cities may have to pay ₹6 lakh to get 0001 as their car registration number. Meanwhile, residents may have to pay ₹1 lakh for this number for their two-wheelers. The Transport Department has proposed to hike fee for VIP registration numbers by 50%.

226.title: Delhi govt to launch training programme for EV mechanics
226.article_body: The Delhi government on Friday announced its plans of creating a training programme for electric vehicle (EV) mechanics. The government stated that the Delhi Skill and Entrepreneurship University (DSEU) will design a course to train students of its automobile engineering diploma programme to become EV mechanics. Every year, about 100 students will be trained in basic and advanced EV mechanics.

227.title: 'Sex Tantra Camp' cancelled in Pune after outfits oppose it: Police
227.article_body: A 'Sex Tantra Camp' which was being organised in Pune was called off on Friday after various outfits opposed it, the police said. The camp offered training in various tantra techniques for a fee of ₹15,000 and was scheduled to take place during the Navratri festival. A case had also been filed against the camp's organisers, an official said.

228.title: Queen Elizabeth's funeral poses biggest ever security test: London Police
228.article_body: London's police force said Queen Elizabeth II's state funeral will be the biggest security operation it has ever undertaken. As a single event, this is larger than the 2012 Olympics and Queen's Platinum Jubilee, London's Metropolitan Police Deputy Assistant Commissioner, Stuart Cundy, said. The force is preparing for events ranging from terrorism threats to protests and crowd crushes, he added.

229.title: Mob beats up 2 women on suspicion of being child-lifters in Thane
229.article_body: A mob allegedly beat up two women on suspicion of being child-lifters in Thane's Mumbra area on Friday. "The two women in burkhas were roaming in the locality and are beggars. Some residents of the colony spotted them and assuming them as child-lifters they were thrashed," a senior police official said. They were rescued after a passer-by informed the police.

230.title: Stray dog seen sleeping on a hospital bed in MP; video goes viral
230.article_body: A video of a dog sleeping on a hospital bed in Madhya Pradesh's Ratlam has gone viral on social media. Ratlam Chief Medical and Health Officer Dr Prabhakar Nanaware said that he was unaware of the incident as he was on leave. The video was reportedly shot at a government hospital in Alot.

231.title: Invitation sent to Harry, Meghan for state reception at Buckingham Palace cancelled: Reports
231.article_body: The invitation sent to Harry and Meghan Markle for the state reception, to be hosted by King Charles and Queen Consort Camilla, at Buckingham Palace has been cancelled, according to reports. The decision was taken after officials at Buckingham Palace insisted the reception was for working Royals only, reports said. World leaders, ambassadors and foreign Royals will attend the reception.

232.title: BBMP stops demolition drive in Mahadevapura, re-survey to be done
232.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has stopped the demolition drive in the Mahadevapura zone and set up a task force to conduct a re-survey to find encroachments. The survey will be carried out in places like Wipro, Prestige Tech Park and Vagdevi Layout, said a BBMP official. The demolition drive against Nalapad Academy has also been put on hold.

233.title: 22-year-old arrested in Pune for posing as policeman, cheating student
233.article_body: A 22-year-old man, who allegedly posed as a policeman and cheated a college student in Pune, has been arrested, police said. The accused intercepted a college student in the Sinhagad Road area, police added. The accused falsely claimed that the victim indulged in prostitution by bringing girls to his house and also allegedly took money from him, police stated.

234.title: China puts on hold proposal to designate Mumbai attacks planner Sajid as global terrorist
234.article_body: China has put a hold on a proposal moved at the United Nations by the US and co-supported by India to designate Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) terrorist Sajid Mir, one of India's most wanted terrorists and the main handler of the 26/11 Mumbai attacks, as a global terrorist. Mir has a bounty of $5 million placed on his head by the US.

235.title: 2 killed after building collapses in Delhi's Johripur Extension
235.article_body: Two people were killed and seven others were injured after a building which was under renovation collapsed in Delhi's Johripur Extension on Friday. Earlier, it was reported that two people were trapped under the debris and rescue operations were underway. Legal action has been initiated, police said. Moreover, Delhi Municipal Corporation said that the building was "over 20 years old".

236.title: ₹140 cr scam accused frees hand from police in Gurugram, held after chase
236.article_body: A prisoner, who is an accused in a ₹140-crore scam, attempted to escape from police custody in Gurugram. FIR stated that police sounded alarm as soon as the prisoner tried to escape and a Sub-Inspector was able to catch him after a distance of over 100 metres. However, he was able to run again, following which, he fell on road.

237.title: What is 'Impact Player' rule BCCI is introducing in T20 tournaments?
237.article_body: BCCI will introduce 'Impact Player' rule in its T20 tournaments. With this, teams can replace a member of their playing XI during a match if they think it'll be useful. 'Impact Player' can be introduced any time before completion of 14th over of either innings. Player replaced by 'Impact Player' can no longer take part in remainder of the match.

238.title: 19-year-old youth shot dead during party in north Delhi, 1 arrested
238.article_body: A 19-year-old youth was shot dead during a party in north Delhi's Subzi Mandi area and one person was arrested in connection with the incident, police said. According to witnesses, someone mistakenly fired a shot and the bullet hit the victim's neck, police added. The victim was rushed to a hospital where doctors declared him dead, police stated.

239.title: Mumbai teacher on way to staff room dies after getting stuck in school lift
239.article_body: A 26-year-old teacher died after getting stuck in the lift of a school building in Mumbai's Malad (west) on Friday. The teacher was reportedly on her way to the school's staff room when the lift suddenly started moving upwards. The deceased got stuck in the lift and was injured. She was taken to the hospital but was declared dead.

240.title: Chile loses FIFA appeal in World Cup case with Ecuador
240.article_body: Chile have lost its appeal to replace Ecuador at FIFA World Cup in Qatar. FIFA dismissed Chile’s argument that Ecuador player Byron Castillo was actually Colombian and ineligible to play in qualifying games. Castillo played in eight of them for Ecuador. Had Ecuador forfeited all eight games, Chile would've risen to fourth automatic qualification place in South American qualifying group.

241.title: I have always looked up to you and admired you: Serena Williams to Roger Federer
241.article_body: Penning a note for Roger Federer following his retirement from tennis, Serena Williams wrote on Instagram, "I have always looked up to you and admired you." She added, "You inspired countless millions and millions of people, including me, and we will never forget." She further wrote, "Welcome to the retirement club. And thank you for being you @rogerfederer."

242.title: Heavy rains claim at least 22 lives in UP
242.article_body: Heavy overnight rains killed at least 22 people in Uttar Pradesh on Friday. The deaths included nine labourers from Jhansi, who died after an under-construction wall collapsed on their huts in Lucknow. Only one man survived the accident. The remaining 13 deaths were reported from Unnao, Fatehpur, Prayagraj, Sitapur, Raebareli and Jhansi, officials said.

243.title: Live-stream proceedings of national importance: Indira Jaising to SC
243.article_body: Senior advocate Indira Jaising has written a letter to Chief Justice of India UU Lalit and other Supreme Court judges urging them to begin live-streaming of proceedings of matters of national importance. Citing freedom of information, she added, "There is no substitute for first-hand knowledge, especially in the era of...'fake news'." Jaising said the apex court should've its own channel.

244.title: PM Modi thanks Uzbek Prez for hosting SCO summit; discusses ties
244.article_body: PM Narendra Modi met Uzbekistan President Shavkat Mirziyoyev in Samarkand on Friday. "Had a great meeting with President Shavkat Mirziyoyev. Thanked him for hosting the SCO (Shanghai Cooperation Organisation) Summit," Modi tweeted. The two leaders discussed "ways to deepen connectivity, trade and cultural cooperation between India and Uzbekistan", according to the tweet.

245.title: German Chancellor Scholz, US Speaker Pelosi meet amid Ukraine war
245.article_body: US Speaker Nancy Pelosi met German Chancellor Olaf Scholz in Berlin on Friday, with talks centred around the Russia-Ukraine war. "We will persist until the guns are silent," said Pelosi. "It (Ukrainian success) requires substantial security support, humanitarian assistance, economic assistance- and sanctions...that make sure that Russia feels the pain of this," she added.

246.title: I thought Kuldeep could've been picked for WC: Ex-India selector
246.article_body: Former India selector Sarandeep Singh said that spinner Kuldeep Yadav could have been picked in the Indian squad for the upcoming T20 World Cup. "You need a wrist spinner in Australia, but then he (Kuldeep) wasn't really in the scheme of things," Sarandeep said. "[Selectors] didn't want to take any risk, especially after losing in the Asia Cup," he added.

247.title: Shami shouldn't have been left out of T20 WC squad: Sarandeep
247.article_body: Former Indian cricketer Sarandeep Singh said that pacer Mohammad Shami "shouldn't have gone out" from the 15-member squad of the upcoming T20 World Cup in Australia. "The way he (Shami) performed for Gujarat, he should have been there in the main squad. Additionally, what he can do with the new ball, I don't think any other bowler can," Sarandeep said.

248.title: India Maharajas defeat World Giants in match to mark India's 75 years of independence
248.article_body: Harbhajan Singh-led India Maharajas defeated Jacques Kallis-led World Giants by six wickets in a special T20 match to mark India's 75 years of independence. Batting first, World Giants put up a total of 170/8 in their 20 overs, with Kevin O'Brien top-scoring with 52(31). India Maharajas chased down target in 18.4 overs as Tanmay Srivastava and Yusuf Pathan scored fifties.

249.title: Australia had a rule to never sledge Sachin while he's batting: Brett Lee
249.article_body: Former Australian pacer Brett Lee said his team never sledged Sachin Tendulkar as "he will (then) be batting out there forever". "Sachin Tendulkar on the field is completely different...you look into his eyes, the eyes of a tiger. He wants it, wants to get into the battle," said Lee. Sachin has scored 20 centuries in total against the Australians.

250.title: 2 people dead after being hit by train in Kerala
250.article_body: Two people died after a train hit them at the Auvaneeswaram Railway Station near Kollam, Kerala on Friday. The deceased were identified as Sajeena (39) and Rahimkutty (62). The railway station doesn't have a foot overbridge and the deceased died when they were on the track, police said. Notably, Rahimkutty was a local panchayat member.

251.title: Former Lankan Prez Sirisena named suspect in 2019 terror attacks
251.article_body: A court in Sri Lanka on Friday named ex-President Maithripala Sirisena as a suspect in the Easter Sunday terrorist bombings of 2019 which killed 270 people in the country. The Colombo Fort Magistrate's Court said 71-year-old Sirisena had neglected intelligence reports which were presented before the bombings. Sirisena's court appearance is scheduled on October 14.

252.title: Rare deep-sea shark with bulging eyes caught in Australia, pic goes viral
252.article_body: A rare deep-sea shark with bulging eyes was pulled lifeless off the Australian coast by a fisherman. The shark was caught from 2,133 feet underwater. Reacting to shark's viral picture, a social media user wrote, "Stuff of nightmares there." Meanwhile, another user wrote, "Looks really happy he's just had his braces off so is accentuating the gums and teeth."

253.title: Don't become a line-length bowler: Curtly Ambrose to Raj Angad Bawa
253.article_body: All-rounder Raj Angad Bawa revealed that West Indian legend Curtly Ambrose has advised him to not lose his pace. "You can trouble the best...with the kind of steep bounce you generate...Don't become a line-length bowler," Ambrose had told the youngster. Bawa earned his maiden India A call-up for a New Zealand A series starting on September 22 in Chennai.

254.title: Defending champions India lose in SAFF Women's Championship 2022 semis
254.article_body: Defending champions India crashed out of the SAFF Women's Championship 2022 after a 0-1 loss against hosts Nepal in the semi-final in Kathmandu on Friday. Rashmi Kumari Ghising scored the only goal of the game in injury time of the first half. Notably, India have lost in semi-final stage for the first time in the history of the tournament.

255.title: Seems that Congress doesn't need me anymore: 91-yr-old Karan Singh
255.article_body: Veteran Congress leader Karan Singh stated that he has been in the party for his whole life but it seems that it doesn't need him anymore. "I've not been invited for the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'...Neither I'm on any [Congress] committee...nor has the party consulted me for some years," the 91-year-old added. He said that he feels separated from the party.

256.title: Auto-rickshaw driver stabbed in Gurugram for denying ride
256.article_body: An auto-rickshaw driver was allegedly stabbed by two people in Gurugram after he denied a ride to them, police said on Friday. The victim in his complaint said that the incident took place on Wednesday while he was waiting for passengers at IFFCO Chowk. The victim was stabbed in the shoulder by two drunk youths, as per his complaint.

257.title: Extreme hunger rose 123% in climate change-hit countries: Ofxam
257.article_body: Extreme hunger has increased by 123% in the last six years in countries which are most affected by climate change, Oxfam has reported. It stated that 48 million people in Afghanistan, Burkina Faso, Djibouti, Guatemala, Haiti, Kenya, Madagascar, Niger, Somalia and Zimbabwe have experienced acute hunger. In 2018, 21 million people experienced acute hunger in these countries.

258.title: PSG manager looking to drop one of Messi, Neymar or Mbappe: Report
258.article_body: PSG manager Christophe Galtier is reportedly considering dropping one of Lionel Messi, Neymar or Kylian Mbappe to adjust his tactics. Galtier is reportedly planning to move away from his 3-4-3 formation as he feels its impact has lessened. The manager is said to consider dropping one of the trio for a forward who is willing to hold shape and press.

259.title: Real Madrid looking to organise Nadal-Federer match at Bernabeu: Report
259.article_body: Spanish football club Real Madrid reportedly wants to organise a tennis match between Roger Federer and Rafael Nadal at the Santiago Bernabeu stadium. The arena is currently undergoing renovation and will only fully be ready at the end of 2022. Federer announced his retirement from tennis on Thursday, while Nadal is an honourary member of the La Liga team.

260.title: Nikki Tamboli met Sukesh in jail, received ₹3.5 lakh cash, Gucci bag from him: ED
260.article_body: Television actress Nikki Tamboli's name has come up amid ongoing investigation in the money laundering case against conman Sukesh Chandrasekhar. According to ED, she met Sukesh while he was in jail. Tamboli received ₹3.5 lakh cash and a Gucci bag from Sukesh, ED stated in its chargesheet, obtained by India Today.

261.title: Queen Elizabeth's funeral security may cost ₹60 crore: Ex-royal security officer
261.article_body: Former royal security officer Simon Morgan has predicted that the cost of the security detail for Queen Elizabeth II's funeral will cost more than $7.5 million (around ₹59.76 crore), the New York Post reported. The British Mi5 and Mi6 intelligence agencies will work with London’s Metropolitan Police and Secret Service to secure the VIPs attending the funeral, the report said.

262.title: Never thought I wouldn’t be a part of 'The Kapil Sharma Show' anymore: Ali Asgar
262.article_body: Actor Ali Asgar recently said he never thought he wouldn't be a part of 'The Kapil Sharma Show' anymore. "After the incident (him quitting the show), there has been no communication (with Kapil)," he said. "So it's difficult to say if we would reunite or not...The day something good comes up, we might be together again," Ali added.

263.title: Beckham waits over 12 hrs in line to see Queen Elizabeth's coffin, pics surface
263.article_body: English football icon David Beckham on Friday turned up with thousands of other people standing in queue to see Queen Elizabeth lie-in-state at Westminster Hall in London. Beckham was pictured paying his last respects to the late monarch after waiting in line for over 12 hours. "I was so lucky...to have a few moments...to be around Her Majesty," he said.

264.title: IT park at a cost ₹600 cr to come up in Madurai: TN CM Stalin
264.article_body: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin on Friday announced that an information technology (IT) park would be set up in Madurai at a cost of ₹600 crore. "The park will be set up in two phases in Madurai's downtown Maatuthavani," Stalin stated. He added that the IT park would come up on a five-acre campus in the first phase.

265.title: 15-year-old Pranav Anand becomes India's 76th chess Grandmaster
265.article_body: Pranav Anand has become India's 76th Grandmaster after crossing 2,500 Elo mark in the ongoing World Youth Chess Championship in Mamaia, Romania. The 15-year-old had scored the third and final GM norm at 55th Biel Chess Festival in Switzerland in July. His first two GM norms came in Sitges Open (January 2022) and Vezerkepso GM Round Robin (March 2022) tournaments.

266.title: Sri Lanka announce their squad for T20 World Cup 2022
266.article_body: Asia Cup 2022 champions Sri Lanka on Friday announced their squad for T20 World Cup 2022. Dinesh Chandimal, the veteran middle-order batter, who made a return to the T20I squad in Asia Cup, has been named as a standby player. Sri Lanka also named Dushmantha Chameera and Lahiru Kumara, but their participation will be subject to their fitness.

267.title: Ambulance arrives in middle of ground as Venkatesh Iyer gets hit on head, pic surfaces
267.article_body: During the Duleep Trophy semi-final between Central Zone and West Zone, an ambulance arrived in the middle of the ground after Central Zone's Venkatesh Iyer was hit on the head. West Zone bowler Chintan Gaja picked ball and threw it back at Iyer in anger, after which Iyer went down in pain. However, Iyer preferred to walk off the field.

268.title: Shoaib Akhtar criticises Pakistan's T20 World Cup 2022 squad selection, shares video
268.article_body: Ex-Pakistan fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar criticised Pakistan's T20 World Cup squad selection. In a video, he called Pakistan's chief selector "average", adding that when chief selector would be average, his selection would also be average. He further said that T20I cricket is not Pakistan head coach Saqlain Mushtaq's forte. "I'm really scared as our batting has no depth," Akhtar stated.

269.title: Leonardo DiCaprio is a very nice man: Gigi Hadid's father amid dating rumours
269.article_body: Commenting on his daughter's rumoured relationship with Hollywood actor Leonardo DiCaprio, model Gigi's father Mohamed Hadid said, "They've known each other for some time." "I've not spoken to my daughter about [him]...I don't think they're dating, I believe they're just good friends," he said. Adding that he met DiCaprio a few years ago, Hadid said, "He's a very nice man."

270.title: Thank God Manmohan Singh did not serve over-cooked food like GST: Chidambaram
270.article_body: Congress MP P Chidambaram commented after Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman reportedly said that the 1991 reforms brought in by the then Finance Minister Manmohan Singh were "half-baked". "Thank God, Dr Manmohan Singh did not serve over-cooked and unpalatable food like demonetisation, multiple-rates GST and savage taxes on petrol & diesel," Chidambaram tweeted.

271.title: Shashi's son shares old pic featuring King Charles III on 'Ahista Ahista' set
271.article_body: Late actor Shashi Kapoor's son Kunal Kapoor took to Instagram to share a throwback picture featuring King Charles III. "On the set - 1st schedule of my 1st film Ahista Ahista," he captioned the post. In the picture, King Charles III could be seen posing for the camera, with Kunal smiling behind him. The film was released in 1981.

272.title: We were 20 runs short: Harmanpreet on 7-wicket loss in 3rd T20I vs England
272.article_body: After India Women's seven-wicket defeat against England Women in third and final T20I, India captain Harmanpreet Kaur said her side was 20 runs short. "Credit to our bowlers for keeping us in the game...One needs to have a decent total in any format of the game. We need partnerships with...bat," she added. India lost the T20I series 1-2.

273.title: All Punjab decisions taken by Delhi AAP leaders: Ex-CM Amarinder
273.article_body: Former Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh said all state decisions are being taken by either AAP's Raghav Chadha or Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal. "They are not letting poor CM (Bhagwant Mann) function," said Singh, adding that the AAP is making "unnecessary noises" about Operation Lotus to "divert attention". Singh also said he's "101% against" the Agnipath scheme.

274.title: Book 'Modi@20' can be used as management textbook: FM
274.article_body: The book on PM Narendra Modi titled 'Modi@20: Dreams Meet Delivery' can be used as a textbook in management courses, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said on Thursday. "It's a book which tells how modern-day governance in a complex economy like India can happen," she added. The book is penned by Amit Shah, Anupam Kher, Amish Tripathi and Sadhguru, among others.

275.title: Why create hubbub when nothing to hide: Naqvi on UP madrasa survey
275.article_body: Speaking about the controversy over the ongoing survey of private madrasas by the UP government, senior BJP leader Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi on Friday said, "Why create a hubbub when there is nothing to hide?" Naqvi also said that doubts should not be raised on "all madrasas". The UP government on Monday began surveying "unrecognised" madrasas in the state.

276.title: Turkey to pay for 25% Russian gas supplies in roubles, says Putin
276.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Friday said that Russia would soon receive 25% of payment for gas exports to Turkey in roubles. He added that an agreement in this regard would come into force in "the near future". Putin was speaking during a meeting with Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan on the sidelines of the ongoing Shanghai Cooperation Organisation summit.

277.title: Sometimes repeating is closest to reliving: Sara recreates 'Kedarnath' look
277.article_body: Actress Sara Ali Khan took to Instagram on Friday and shared a picture of her recreating her own look from the film 'Kedarnath'. "Decided to repeat my Kedarnath wardrobe. Sometimes repeating is the closest to reliving," she wrote. 'Kedarnath', which also featured late actor Sushant Singh Rajput, marked Sara's acting debut in Bollywood. The film was released in 2018.

278.title: Haaland is the perfect person to manage: Man City manager Guardiola
278.article_body: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola praised Erling Haaland, saying the 22-year-old is an "exceptional striker" and the "perfect person" to manage. "At the age that he is, his ambition, he wants to be better and will be better," he added. Haaland was named Premier League 'Player of the Month' for August on Friday. Manchester City are currently second in standings.

279.title: Patanjali working on lumpy skin disease solution: Baba Ramdev
279.article_body: Baba Ramdev said his Patanjali Group is working on finding solutions for the lumpy skin disease that has caused the deaths of over 1 lakh cows since July. Ramdev also alleged that the disease might have "come from Pakistan". He added that the disease affected many cows in his shelter house in Haridwar but so far no cow had died.

280.title: Fire breaks out at poha factory in Ujjain; 3 women dead
280.article_body: Three women were charred to death after a fire broke out at Bindal poha factory located in Udyogpuri in Madhya Pradesh's Ujjain on Friday. The women were working inside the factory at the time of the incident. Another woman who was critically injured in the fire was rushed to hospital. The fire brigade reached the spot and controlled the fire.

281.title: Money, power & other means being used to topple govts: NCP chief
281.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Thursday criticised the BJP and said that money, power and other means were being used to topple governments in the country. "In Maharashtra, 40 to 50 MLAs defected and the government changed," Pawar said. He further alleged that central probe agencies were being misused to target opposition parties and their leaders.

282.title: Supreme Court gives Centre time till December 15 to implement OROP
282.article_body: Supreme Court has allowed the Centre time till December 15 to implement the One Rank One Pension (OROP) scheme. The Centre had moved an application to extend the June deadline stating that re-fixation of pension is a "time consuming" process. The Centre assured the bench that it was "taking earnest steps" to comply with the order which requires Cabinet approval.

283.title: Cong not doing 'Bharat Jodo', but 'Goonda Jodo Yatra': BJP's Poonawalla
283.article_body: BJP spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla accused the Congress of engaging goons across the country in the name of 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'. His comment comes after a video surfaced showing local Congress leaders allegedly extorting donations from a vegetable vendor in Kerala's Kollam. "This is not Congress' India Jodo Yatra, but, Goonda Jodo, Recovery Jodo, and Corruption Jodo Yatra," he said.

284.title: NGT orders Rajasthan to pay ₹3,000 cr for improper waste management
284.article_body: The National Green Tribunal (NGT) has directed the Rajasthan government to pay ₹3,000 crore as compensation for improper management of solid and liquid waste. "The compensation had to be equal to the loss to the environment and the cost of remediation," said the bench. It also called for further damage to be prevented and past damage to be "restored".

285.title: Holiday for schools in Puducherry till Sept 25 as fever cases spike
285.article_body: A holiday has been declared for all schools in Puducherry and Karaikal for classes 1-8 from September 17-25 following a "sudden spike in fever cases among children", the Puducherry government announced on Friday. The decision was taken considering the well-being of the children and on the directions of the Union Territory's Chief Minister N Rangasamy and Education Minister A Namassivayam.

286.title: Malaika Arora & Amrita Arora to do a series titled 'Arora Sisters': Report
286.article_body: Malaika Arora and her actress-sister Amrita Arora are set to appear in a series titled 'Arora Sisters', according to a report. The upcoming web series will focus on the personal and professional lives of the siblings, the report said. "The show will also feature Amrita and Malaika's inner circle of folks and friends," a source quoted by Pinkvilla said.

287.title: Broadest mobilisation of secular forces needed to defeat Hindutva: CPI(M)
287.article_body: The CPI(M) said that the "broadest mobilisation of secular forces is needed to defeat Hindutva communalism". In a communique, the Polit Bureau of the CPI(M) stated, "The CPI(M) will work to develop its independent strength, strengthen Left unity, forge unity of Left & Democratic forces." It added, "BJP's claim of any role in forcing Nizam's surrender [of Hyderabad] is farcical."

288.title: Bahrain confirms first case of monkeypox in 29-year-old expatriate
288.article_body: Bahrain has reported its first confirmed case of monkeypox, the country's state news agency BNA reported on Friday citing the health ministry. The infection was detected in a 29-year-old male expatriate, as per BNA's report. Bahrain's health ministry said that the man was returning from abroad when his symptoms were suspected and diagnosed, the report added.

289.title: Maha man puts daughter's body in salt pit after alleged rape, seeks 2nd autopsy
289.article_body: The body of a woman was preserved in a salt pit for 44 days in Maharashtra's Nandurbar by her father, who alleged that she had been gang-raped and murdered, a police officer said. The man had demanded that a second post-mortem be conducted on her. According to police, three persons have been arrested in connection with the case.

290.title: He came, we saw, he conquered, we admired: Tsitsipas on Federer's retirement
290.article_body: Paying tribute to Roger Federer after he announced his retirement, world number six Stefanos Tsitsipas took to Instagram and wrote, "He came. We saw. He conquered. We admired. Thank you Roger Federer for elevating our sport to an unfathomable extent." He added, "I can't thank you enough for being the reason I pursued tennis in the first place."

291.title: Siddique Kappan is my best friend, our kids are proud of him: Wife
291.article_body: Journalist Siddique Kappan's wife on Friday stated that their children are very proud of Siddique and are "broken" seeing how he has been subjected to torture. Raihanath claimed that her daughter, who wanted to become a teacher, now wants to become an advocate to fight for her father and people like him. She also called her husband her best friend.

292.title: Will soon bring a right to health bill: Rajasthan CM
292.article_body: Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot on Friday said that his government will soon bring a right to health bill. "I hope that soon this bill will be passed so that people get their rights," he added. Mentioning the old pension scheme and the separate budget for farmers, he claimed that his government's schemes have been "brilliant" so far.

293.title: Vinesh reveals facing period cramps at World C'ships, says 'Tried period-stopping tablets'
293.article_body: Wrestler Vinesh Phogat, who recently created history by becoming the first Indian woman to win multiple medals at World Championships, revealed she battled period cramps during the World Championships in Belgrade. "I tried period-stopping tablets for the first time, but it happened at Dubai [during transit], and I thought all...hard work of the past 10 months is gone," she said.

294.title: What is Roger Federer's record against rivals Rafael Nadal and Novak Djokovic?
294.article_body: Roger Federer and Rafael Nadal played 40 matches together, with Federer winning 16 and Nadal winning 24. Their first match against each other took place in 2004 at Miami, which Nadal won, while their last match was at Wimbledon 2019, which Federer won. Federer and Novak Djokovic played against each other 50 times, with Djokovic winning 27 and Federer 23.

295.title: If picked, Ashwin will know how to perform in T20 WC in Australia: Vettori
295.article_body: Ex-New Zealand captain Daniel Vettori said all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin, who has been included in India's 15-member squad for T20 World Cup 2022, will know how to perform in Australia if he's picked in the playing XI. "He's one of those guys who's very adaptable...understands what he needs to do in all situations...He's been to Australia on a number of occasions."

296.title: K'taka to launch 15-day health campaign on PM Modi's birthday
296.article_body: Karnataka Health Minister K Sudhakar on Friday said the state will launch a 15-day health campaign on PM Narendra Modi's birthday on Saturday. CM Basavaraj Bommai will inaugurate the campaign at Bangalore Medical College and Research Institute, he added. He stated that health parameters will be screened at healthcare facilities during the campaign, which aims to create awareness among people.

297.title: Was sexually assaulted by 10-15 men daily: 14-yr-old girl who worked at Gurugram spa
297.article_body: A 14-year-old girl who worked as a receptionist at a Gurugram spa alleged that she was raped and forced into prostitution by the spa's operator and her aides. "On any given day...10-15 men would assault me," the girl told police. The accused allegedly filmed the first sexual assault and threatened the girl so that she would continue to work there.

298.title: If Disha Vakani doesn't come back, we'll get a new actor: 'Taarak...' producer
298.article_body: 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah' producer Asit Kumarr Modi spoke about Disha Vakani's absence from the show and said if she doesn't come back, he'll get a new actor to play the role of  Daya. Disha took a maternity break in 2017 after delivering a baby girl. "I...waited for her during...pandemic and I'm waiting for her even today," said Asit.

299.title: Extinct prehistoric reptile that lived among dinosaurs discovered in US
299.article_body: The well-preserved fossil of a new extinct species of a lizard-like reptile that lived amongst dinosaurs has been discovered in Wyoming's Morrison Formation in the US. Named Opisthiamimus gregori, the species inhabited Jurassic North America around 150 million years ago. It measured about 6 inches from nose to tail, and likely survived on a diet of insects and small invertebrates.

300.title: I think Anderson-Broad is best attack in world: Ex-English seamer
300.article_body: Former English seamer Tim Bresnan said that the bowling duo of James Anderson and Stuart Broad is the "best bowling attack at the moment" across all conditions. "They came out on top [against South Africa] so you got to say they are the best," Bresnan said. He added, "Hopefully Anderson plays for as long as he wants."

301.title: Haven't levelled personal allegations against Sharad Pawar: Maha BJP chief
301.article_body: Maharashtra BJP chief Chandrashekhar Bawankule on Friday said he had not levelled any personal allegation against NCP chief Sharad Pawar. "We're strengthening our party through our works," Bawankule said. "My statement on finishing off NCP in Baramati was taken as a personal allegation by Pawar," he added. Bawankule's statement had invited a sharp rebuke from the NCP.

302.title: AAP MLA Amanatullah Khan arrested in Waqf board corruption case
302.article_body: The Delhi Police's Anti-Corruption Branch (ACB) on Friday arrested AAP MLA Amanatullah Khan after questioning him for hours in connection with a corruption case involving the Delhi Waqf Board. The arrest came after the ACB found incriminating material and evidence against Khan during searches conducted earlier in the day on the premises of the MLA and his aide.

303.title: Create portal for Ukraine-return medical students: SC to Centre
303.article_body: The Supreme Court on Friday suggested the Centre create a web portal to help medical students, who returned from Ukraine, complete their courses in alternate foreign universities. It said the portal must mention fees and the number of seats available in universities. Earlier, the Centre said the students cannot be accommodated in Indian colleges due to a lack of provisions.

304.title: He's got to mature a bit more: Tim Bresnan on Hardik Pandya
304.article_body: Former English seamer Tim Bresnan said that Indian all-rounder Hardik Pandya "got to mature a bit more" in order to become a "top player". Speaking about various teams' chances to win the upcoming T20 World Cup, Bresnan said, "I think England, Australia and New Zealand are probably the three favourites. But India and Pakistan have the same chance."

305.title: Will be cheering for India: IM Vijayan ahead of U-17 Women's World Cup
305.article_body: Ahead of FIFA Under-17 Women's World Cup, ex-Indian football player IM Vijayan said it's a great opportunity for the Indian team and there's absolutely no pressure on them. "This is the best age to play against some of the top teams like Brazil...USA...I for one will certainly be cheering them on," he added. World Cup will be held in India.

306.title: Begusarai shooting a terror attack, NIA or CBI must probe: BJP leader Giriraj Singh
306.article_body: Calling the Begusarai mass shooting incident a "terrorist attack", Union Minister and senior BJP leader Giriraj Singh on Friday demanded that the National Investigation Agency (NIA) or Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) must probe the matter. He also criticised the Nitish Kumar-led Bihar government and said the incident has exposed the face of the ruling regime.

307.title: PM Modi, Turkish Prez Erdogan discuss bilateral ties in Samarkand
307.article_body: PM Narendra Modi and Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan met in Samarkand, Uzbekistan, on Friday. The two leaders, who are participating in the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) Summit in Uzbekistan, reviewed bilateral ties and discussed ways to enhance cooperation. Ministry of External Affairs Spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said the leaders "appreciated recent gains in bilateral trade".

308.title: 9 killed, 20 injured in stampede at concert in Guatemala
308.article_body: At least nine people were killed and nearly 20 were injured after a stampede broke out at a concert venue in Guatemala on Thursday as the country celebrated its independence day, according to rescuers. The stampede reportedly occurred at one of the exits of the fairground where the concert was held. The incident happened towards the end of the concert.

309.title: Milind Soman buys ₹6.8 crore sea-facing 4 BHK apartment in Mumbai, pics surface
309.article_body: Actor-model Milind Soman has bought a new sea-facing home worth around ₹6.8 crore in Mumbai's Prabhadevi area. According to reports, Milind's new property is in a standalone tower Ocean Star. The 4 BHK apartment reportedly has a carpet area of 1,720 sq ft and comes with two parking slots. It offers views of the Arabian Sea and Bandra Worli Sea-Link.

310.title: Video shows all of Roger Federer's 103 trophy lifts
310.article_body: Roger Federer, who announced his retirement on Thursday, won 103 singles titles. The 41-year-old bagged his first ATP title win in 2001 at Milan. His most successful calendar year was 2006 during which he won 12 titles. He holds records for most titles at Basel (10), Halle (10), Wimbledon (8), ATP Masters 1000 Cincinnati (7) and Nitto ATP Finals (6).

311.title: Kerala man carrying gun escorts girl students amid stray dog menace
311.article_body: A video of a man carrying an air gun and leading a group of girl students to a local madrasa in Kerala's Kasargod has surfaced online. He said he decided to accompany the children, including his daughter, to draw the attention of authorities on stray dog menace. He added that he would shoot the dogs if they attacked the children.

312.title: Former Gujarat CM Shankersinh Vaghela meets Telangana CM KCR
312.article_body: Former Gujarat CM Shankersinh Vaghela met Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao in Hyderabad on Friday. "We had [a] fruitful meeting where we discussed the national political issues," Vaghela tweeted. The meeting of the two senior leaders comes after KCR's office recently stated that the formation of a national party and formulation of its policies will take place soon.

313.title: RSS, BJP giving communal colour to Lakhimpur Kheri incident: Cong
313.article_body: The Congress on Friday accused BJP and RSS of giving a communal colour to the alleged rape and murder of two Dalit sisters in Uttar Pradesh's Lakhimpur Kheri. They demanded that justice delivery in the case be fast-tracked. Congress' Rajesh Lilothia said the incident should not be seen as an isolated incident and alleged that atrocities against Dalits are rising.

314.title: It's hard to see this day: Novak Djokovic on Roger Federer's retirement
314.article_body: Novak Djokovic took to Instagram to pen a note on Roger Federer's retirement. He wrote, "Roger...it's hard to see this day and put into words all...we've shared in this sport together." He added, "It's an honour to know you on and off court...and for many more years to come. I know...this new chapter will hold amazing things for you."

315.title: PCB responds to Shahid Afridi's allegations over Shaheen Afridi’s treatment
315.article_body: After Shahid Afridi claimed PCB isn't doing anything for Shaheen Afridi's treatment and Shaheen is spending his own money, PCB said, "He's making excellent progress in...London...He's on track to make...full recovery...for...T20 World Cup." It added, "It goes without saying...PCB has always been and will continue to be responsible for arranging medical care and rehabilitation of...its players."

316.title: Variety predicts 2 Oscar nominations for RRR, including Best Int'l Film
316.article_body: American media company Variety has published its list of potential Oscar nominees in various categories and SS Rajamouli's 'RRR' has featured in two of them. The publication has predicted that 'RRR' will be nominated for its song 'Dosti' in the Best Original Song category. 'RRR' is also predicted to get nominated for the Best International Feature Film.

317.title: 2 clerics, 5 members of banned JeI arrested under PSA in J&K
317.article_body: Two Islamic clerics and five members of the banned Jamaat-e-Islami (JeI) have been arrested in Jammu & Kashmir (J&K) under the Public Safety Act (PSA), police said. The two clerics, Abdul Rashid Dawoodi and Mushtaq Ahmad Veeri, have a significant following on social media. Those arrested under the PSA can be detained for up to two years.

318.title: SCO must create resilient supply chain in our region: PM amid Ukraine war
318.article_body: Addressing a session of the SCO summit in Uzbekistan, PM Narendra Modi said on Friday that the SCO should create "resilient and diversified supply chains" in the region. "The pandemic and the crisis in Ukraine caused many obstacles in global supply chains, due to which the whole world is facing an unprecedented energy and food crisis," he further said.

319.title: Mukesh Ambani makes ₹1.5 cr offering at Lord Venkateshwara shrine in Andhra: Report
319.article_body: Billionaire Reliance Industries Limited Chairman Mukesh Ambani on Friday handed over a cheque for ₹1.5 crore to the ancient Lord Venkateshwara hill shrine in Andhra Pradesh, PTI reported. A Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams (TTD) official told PTI that Ambani visited the shrine on Friday with his son Anant Ambani's fiancée Radhika Merchant. Ambani also performed Abhishekam ritual there, PTI said.

320.title: Tamil Nadu pastor arrested for raping, impregnating minor girl
320.article_body: After absconding for around 1.5 years, a Tamil Nadu-based pastor was finally arrested for allegedly raping and impregnating a minor girl. The accused, Prince Charles (59), was arrested along with his 29-year-old son for allegedly raping the minor, who delivered a baby in 2020, police said. Notably, the crime was allegedly committed at a children's home in Vayalur, Tiruvallur.

321.title: Rajasthan HC's Justice Rameshwar Vyas tenders resignation
321.article_body: Justice Rameshwar Vyas, a Rajasthan High Court judge, has tendered his resignation, which took effect from August 31, 2022. Vyas was due for superannuation on September 10. “Shri Justice Rameshwar Vyas has tendered his resignation...in pursuance of proviso (a) to clause (1) of Article 217 of the Constitution, with effect from 31.08.2022 afternoon,” read a government notification.

322.title: Indian Coast Guard rescues 19 persons from sinking ship near Ratnagiri
322.article_body: Indian Coast Guard carried out a rescue operation at Motor Tanker Parth, which was sinking near Maharashtra's Ratnagiri on Friday. They saved 19 persons, including 18 Indians and an Ethiopian Master, from the ship. The Gabon-flagged vessel was on its way to New Mangalore from UAE. It reported flooding at about 9:23 am, following which rescue teams were sent immediately.

323.title: Want to transform India into a manufacturing hub: PM at SCO summit
323.article_body: Speaking at the SCO summit in Uzbekistan, PM Narendra Modi on Friday said that the Centre is working on transforming India into a manufacturing hub. "We're supporting innovation in every sector. Today, there are [over] 70,000 startups in India," he said. India is ready to set up 'Special Working Group' to coordinate with SCO nations on innovation technology, he added.

324.title: Mom had said 'Woh kabhi picture nahi bana sakta': Gauri on Karan Johar
324.article_body: Gauri Khan revealed on 'Fabulous Lives of Bollywood Wives' that her mother wasn't happy with Karan Johar directing Shah Rukh Khan in 'Kuch Kuch Hota Hai'. "I told mom Shah Rukh is shooting for Karan's film...She reacted, 'Bilkul nahi, woh kabhi picture nahi bana sakta (He can never make a film).' Only...one person...knew he's...genius," Gauri said pointing at herself.

325.title: Delhi teacher beats security guard in school campus; video surfaces
325.article_body: A video purportedly showing a teacher of a government school in Delhi beating a security guard on the school premises has surfaced online. According to police, both the teacher and the security guard filed a complaint two days after the incident. Police have asked them to give their written statement.

326.title: Guj MLA Mevani, 18 others sentenced to 6-month jail in 2016 rioting case
326.article_body: A court in Gujarat's Ahmedabad on Friday sentenced MLA Jignesh Mevani and 18 others to six-month simple imprisonment in a case of rioting and unlawful assembly in 2016. The case was related to a road blockade agitation staged by Mevani and his associates. Mevani had organised the protest to rename Gujarat University's Law Bhavan building after Dr BR Ambedkar.

327.title: Punjab man, brother kill neighbour who stopped man from hitting wife
327.article_body: A man and his brother have been booked in Punjab's Ludhiana for murdering their neighbour who tried to stop the man from beating his wife. The victim was killed when he again intervened as the accused beat his father-in-law. The victim's wife filed the complaint alleging that her husband was killed by the duo with an iron rod.

328.title: Man City's Haaland wins Premier League 'Player of the Month' for August
328.article_body: Manchester City forward Erling Haaland has been named Premier League's 'Player of the Month' for August. The 22-year-old scored nine goals in his opening five matches in August before making that 10 in six in early September. "I'm delighted to win this award for the first time- it was an incredible start of the season for the team," said Haaland.

329.title: Show 56-inch chest to China or surrender: Swamy to PM Modi
329.article_body: Former BJP MP Subramanian Swamy has told PM Narendra Modi to "demonstrate" his '56-inch chest' by telling China to "get PLA out of Indian territory". Swamy said if PM Modi couldn't do this, then he should "surrender to China...as per Adani's advice". Earlier, Swamy said he was "two steps away" from being in the "same situation" as Haren Pandya.

330.title: 'Can't offer birthday wishes to you in advance,' says Putin to PM Modi; video surfaces
330.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Friday told PM Narendra Modi, "I know that tomorrow, my dear friend, you're about to celebrate your birthday." Putin continued, "As per Russian tradition, we never offer congratulations in advance. So I cannot do that right now." Speaking in Uzbekistan, the Russian President told PM, "We wish you all the best...we wish prosperity to India."

331.title: Babar should use his feet against fast bowlers: Herschelle Gibbs
331.article_body: Former South African batter Herschelle Gibbs said that if Pakistan skipper Babar Azam "adds one or two more attacking options to his game" then the latter's "strike rate will improve and be even more effective". "Using his feet to the quicks to disrupt their lengths and slog sweeping the spinners. Those are two low-risk shots but effective," Gibbs tweeted.

332.title: BJP destroying democracy with Operation Lotus: Ex-BJP MP Sushant
332.article_body: Former MP from Himachal Pradhesh's Kangra, Dr Rajan Sushant, said his former party, the BJP, is "destroying democracy by indulging in horse-trading under Operation Lotus". "If it succeeds, we would be in an East India Company rule kind of situation in the long term," he said. Sushant said the BJP was taking the country to "an Emergency-like situation of 1975".

333.title: 1 killed in Kherson in Ukrainian strike: Pro-Russia official
333.article_body: At least one person was killed and several others were injured after Ukrainian forces bombarded government buildings in the Russian-controlled Kherson city on Friday, the Russian-installed deputy head of the Kherson region said. The official also claimed that US-made HIMARS rockets were used in the strike. Russia seized control of the Kherson region shortly after invading Ukraine in February.

334.title: UP woman allegedly held captive for 8 days & raped, FIR filed
334.article_body: Police in UP's Pilibhit filed a case against a man who allegedly kept a woman captive for eight days and raped her after the survivor approached a local court. As per a police official, the woman said the man "seduced" her. The man and woman reportedly knew each other and she was saved from captivity by her mother.

335.title: IndiGo flight makes emergency landing at Kanpur airport due to technical snag
335.article_body: An Indore-bound IndiGo flight was grounded at Kanpur airport following a technical snag, the airlines stated, as reported by ANI. An alternate aircraft was also reportedly arranged by IndiGo for the passengers. In another such incident, an IndiGo flight from Bhopal to Mumbai was also grounded earlier this month due to a technical glitch, the Airports Authority of India stated.

336.title: It's been a privilege to witness your career: World no. 1 Swiatek to Federer
336.article_body: Reacting to Roger Federer's retirement news, world number one Iga Swiatek took to Twitter and wrote, "I just want to thank you for everything you've done and everything you are for our sport." She added, "It's been a privilege to witness your career. I wish you all the best." The 20-time Grand Slam champion last played at Wimbledon 2021.

337.title: AIADMK holds state-wide protest against power tariff hike in TN
337.article_body: AIADMK, the Opposition party in Tamil Nadu, on Friday staged a state-wide protest against the power tariff hike by the ruling DMK government. AIADMK leaders raised slogans, urging the state government to roll back the hike. "With a constant annual hike, the prices by 2026 will have increased by 30% and will affect the public," AIADMK's Edappadi K Palaniswami said.

338.title: India facing highest unemployment rate in last 45 years: Rahul Gandhi
338.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, who is on 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', on Friday said India is facing the highest unemployment rate in the last 45 years. "Educated youngsters are wandering in search of employment," he said. "I'm meeting...many youngsters during our Bharat Jodo trip, understanding their expectations from the government...and how many more possibilities can we create for them," he said.

339.title: 5-yr-old becomes India's youngest to undergo en-bloc kidney transplant
339.article_body: A 5-year-old boy from Haryana has become the youngest Indian to undergo en-bloc kidney transplant surgery in the country at All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS), Delhi. The donor of the kidneys was a 16-month-old baby who was declared brain dead. The recipient was suffering from an autoimmune disease that affected both his kidneys, Dr Manjunath Maruti Pol said.

340.title: The current era is not an era of war: PM Modi to Russian Prez on Ukraine war
340.article_body: PM Narendra Modi today told Russian President Vladimir Putin that the 'current era is not one of war'. "I've spoken to you about it on the call. Today we'll get the opportunity to talk about how can we progress on the path of peace," said PM to Putin in Uzbekistan. This is their first meeting since the Ukraine war began.

341.title: Nadiadwala's film on 'Mahabharat' to release in 20 languages: Report
341.article_body: Producer Firoz Nadiadwala's upcoming film on 'Mahabharat' will reportedly be released in 20 languages. As per a source quoted by Pinkvilla, it will release in 15 international languages, including English, Thai, Mandarin, Russian, Japanese, African, Arabic, Korean, Cantonese and Malaysian among others. The film will reportedly also release in Hindi, Tamil, Telugu, Malayalam and Kannada.

342.title: Blue light from phones may lead to earlier onset of puberty: Study
342.article_body: As per research, blue light from phones and tablets may lead to earlier onset of puberty in children. Melatonin is a hormone that helps control the sleep cycle and is associated with delaying the start of puberty in children. Its levels drop naturally as children grow up. But the blue light suppresses the level of melatonin, resulting in early puberty.

343.title: Restaurant's Muslim manager arrested for preserving raw cow meat in Surat
343.article_body: A Muslim manager of a restaurant, Delhi Dastarkhwan, in Surat was arrested for allegedly preserving raw cow meat in the restaurant's freezer. However, the accused, Sarfaraz Khan, claimed it to be buffalo meat. Meanwhile, the Forensic Science Laboratory's report mentioned that out of the six samples, two samples were cow meat while others were buffalo meat, police said.

344.title: 2 arrested from Haryana's Hisar for GST fraud of around ₹75 cr
344.article_body: Police arrested two people from Haryana's Hisar for allegedly evading goods and services tax of about ₹75 crore. The accused, Shubham and Deepanshu, were involved in creating fake firms and invoices, a police spokesperson said. "Police...recovered PAN cards, Aadhar Cards...two laptops, mobile phones, note-counting machine, blank cheques and a hard disk from the...accused," the spokesperson added.

345.title: Will beautify Delhi if get control of MCD: CM Arvind Kejriwal
345.article_body: Accusing the current MCD of trying to turn Delhi into a city of "garbage mountains", CM Arvind Kejriwal said if AAP gets control of the MCD, it'll beautify the national capital. "The government is working to make Delhi a City of Tirangas, lakes and parks and these people want to turn it into a city of garbage mountains," he added.

346.title: PM Modi true follower of BR Ambedkar: Former President Kovind
346.article_body: Former President Ram Nath Kovind on Friday said PM Narendra Modi is a true follower of BR Ambedkar and is working towards turning the social reformer's vision into reality. "As Babasaheb had said we are Indians first, Indians later and Indians till the end, PM Modi also says India first," Kovind said. PM Modi is vindicating Babasaheb's vision, he added.

347.title: We know your concerns on Ukraine war, want it to end soon: Putin to PM Modi
347.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Friday told PM Narendra Modi that Russia knew about India's stand and "concerns" on the conflict in Ukraine. "We want all of this to end as soon as possible," Putin told PM Modi on the sidelines of the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) summit in Uzbekistan. "We'll keep you abreast of what's happening there," said Putin.

348.title: I save screenshots of posts that make personal attacks: Dulquer
348.article_body: Actor Dulquer Salmaan said in an interview that he saves screenshots of social media posts that make personal attacks.
