"If you search...my phone, you'll find screenshots of comments that personally attack me. I...even look at them from time to time," Dulquer said, adding, "Twitter, Instagram, YouTube, (I save them all). I remember the IDs of all those who attack me."

349.title: Reply to PIL on reduced hours in govt schools: HC to Delhi govt
349.article_body: The High Court has asked the Delhi government to respond to Public Interest Litigation (PIL) which alleged government schools in the city's northeast were conducting classes either on alternate days or for reduced hours. The pleas said classes were being held irregularly due to a lack of infrastructure. The court asked the government to respond in three weeks.

350.title: AAP MLA Amanatullah Khan raided by ACB in Waqf board corruption case
350.article_body: The Delhi Police's Anti-Corruption Branch (ACB) on Friday raided AAP MLA Amanatullah Khan's house and five other locations linked to him in a two-year-old corruption case involving the Delhi Waqf Board. As per reports, an unlicensed weapon and cash worth ₹12 lakh were seized from an aide of the MLA. Khan was called for questioning on Friday at 12 pm.

351.title: Irfan Pathan names his India playing XI for T20 World Cup 2022
351.article_body: Ex-Team India all-rounder Irfan Pathan has named his Team India playing XI for T20 World Cup 2022, which will begin in Australia next month. Irfan named Rohit Sharma and KL Rahul as his openers. Other players in the playing XI include Virat Kohli, Suryakumar Yadav, Deepak Hooda, Hardik Pandya, Dinesh Karthik, Harshal Patel, Bhuvneshwar Kumar, Jasprit Bumrah and Yuzvendra Chahal

352.title: Who is invited and who is not to Queen Elizabeth's funeral?
352.article_body: Japan's Emperor Naruhito and Empress Masako will come for Queen Elizabeth II's funeral. Dutch King Willem-Alexander, King Philippe of Belgium, King Harald V of Norway will also attend. Among global leaders, US President Joe Biden and French President Emmanuel Macron will attend the funeral. Russia and Belarus will be excluded, along with Myanmar and North Korea, said reports.

353.title: Clean buses & maintain punctuality: PMPML passengers in survey
353.article_body: Dirty buses, non-maintenance of punctuality and dilapidated bus stops are the main criticisms the Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) has received in a survey it conducted among 2 lakh passengers. Among the replies, 69,252 were positive, 861 were negative and 55,454 made suggestions. The suggestions included restarting the ₹70-bus passes and launching a PMPML application.

354.title: Delhi records 8th monkeypox case as Nigerian woman tests positive
354.article_body: A 30-year-old Nigerian woman has tested positive for monkeypox in Delhi, becoming the city's eighth case of the disease and the 13th case across India. The woman is currently admitted to Lok Nayak Jai Prakash Narayan (LNJP) Hospital. Monkeypox is a zoonotic viral disease which causes symptoms such as skin lesions, headache, fever, muscle aches and sore throat.

355.title: 50-yr-old man sodomises 12-yr-old UP boy, tries to kill him; arrested
355.article_body: A 50-year-old man has been arrested for sodomising a 12-year-old boy in a village in Uttar Pradesh. The boy was reportedly playing outside his house when Brahma Nand persuaded him to accompany him to a nearby field. After sodomising him, Nand tried to kill the boy by tying a rope around his neck. However, the boy managed to escape.

356.title: Harassment by loan apps rose 376% after pandemic: Pune Police
356.article_body: Complaints of harassment against persons running instant loan applications have increased by 376% after the COVID-19 pandemic, stated Pune Police's Cyber Cell. In 2019, police received 322 such complaints. The number rose to 837 complaints in 2020, then 928 in 2021 and 3,151 in 2022. Cyber cell Inspector Kumar Ghadge said these applications do not follow regular banking procedures.

357.title: Gang that sold cooking gas for commercial purposes busted in Mumbai
357.article_body: The Mumbai Police have busted a gang that used to convert LPG cylinders meant for household use under government subsidies, into commercial cylinders, by registering as fake consumers with gas agencies. The police arrested three accused, Trimuthi Tirumal (35), Mangilal Bisnoi (32) and Shravan Bisnoi (35), from a godown in Malwani and recovered 194 LPG cylinders.

358.title: Babar would've gotten lot of support if Malik was in Pak's T20 WC team: Afridi
358.article_body: Following Shoaib Malik's exclusion from Pakistan's 15-member squad for next month's T20 World Cup 2022, Shahid Afridi said the all-rounder deserves to be part of the squad. "He is a top choice for every franchise...[Captain] Babar Azam would have gotten a lot of support if Malik had been there, even if he was on the bench," he added.

359.title: Who is Pinky Irani, the woman who put Sukesh Chandrasekhar in touch with actors, models?
359.article_body: Pinky Irani, who was questioned in the money laundering case involving Sukesh Chandrasekhar, has been described as a "personal shopper" for actresses, including Jacqueline Fernandez. According to police, she was an anchor and is "well-connected" in entertainment industry. She'd allegedly ask actors and models to meet Sukesh or talk to him, and buy expensive gifts for them from his money.

360.title: Chinese officials banned from viewing Queen Elizabeth's coffin in UK: Reports
360.article_body: Chinese government officials who will visit the UK for Queen Elizabeth's funeral have been banned from viewing the late monarch as she lies-in-state at Westminster Hall, reports said on Friday. The delegation has been blocked from the vigil over sanctions imposed on British parliamentarians for criticising alleged human rights violations in Xinjiang. Five British MPs were sanctioned by Beijing.

361.title: No way to repay what SRK has done on Brahmastra: Ayan Mukerji
361.article_body: 'Brahmastra' director Ayan Mukerji in an interview said, "There is no way to ever repay what Shah Rukh Khan has done on Brahmastra." "Unanimously, one of the favourite things in Brahmastra has been Shah Rukh sir's sequence," he added. Shah Rukh played the role of scientist Mohan Bhargav in the film.

362.title: Fatal road crashes in Delhi rose by 3.6% in 2021: Report
362.article_body: Fatal road crashes in Delhi went up by 3.6% in 2021 as compared to 2020, whereas total crashes rose by 13%, as per a report released by Delhi Police. The national capital witnessed 4,720 road crashes in 2021 in which 1,239 people lost their lives, the report added. Around 40.7% of the total persons killed in road crashes were pedestrians.

363.title: Mumbai man arrested for killing wife, dumping her headless body in creek
363.article_body: A 32-year-old man from Mumbai's Nalasopara has been arrested for allegedly killing his wife and dumping her headless body in creek last year in Palghar. This year on August 29, the woman's grandmother approached police stating the woman had been missing for a year. Upon investigation, police found that her husband, who was suspicious of her character, had killed her.

364.title: US chess player accused of using sex toy to win against Magnus Carlsen, denies claims
364.article_body: A 19-year-old grandmaster has been accused of cheating to win a September 4 match against World Number one chess player Magnus Carlsen. American Hans Niemann denied online allegations that he used anal beads (a type of sex toy) that would vibrate and tell him about the best moves. "If they want me to strip naked, I'll do it," said Niemann.

365.title: TDP MLAs protest near Speaker's chair, suspended from Andhra Assembly
365.article_body: Andhra Pradesh Assembly Speaker Tammineni Seetharam suspended 13 Telugu Desam Party (TDP) MLAs from the Assembly on Friday. The MLAs, who had surrounded Seetharam's chair and raised slogans, were evicted from the House by marshals. They wanted a discussion on rising prices by adjourning other items on the agenda. Notably, 16 TDP MLAs were suspended from the Assembly on Thursday.

366.title: Fertiliser crisis in Bihar artificial: Union Minister Bhagwanth Khuba
366.article_body: Union Minister of State for Chemicals and Fertilisers Bhagwanth Khuba accused the Nitish Kumar government of creating an artificial fertiliser crisis in Bihar despite adequate supply from the central government. "I urge...farmers not to pay even a penny extra, as the Narendra Modi government is giving heavy subsidies on urea, DAP, NPK, etc for the benefit of farmers," Khuba added.

367.title: My relations with Congress are almost zero: Veteran leader Karan Singh
367.article_body: Veteran Congress leader Karan Singh showed disappointment towards party functionaries and said that his relations with the grand old party are almost zero. Sharing that he was dropped from the working committee, he said, "Yes, I'm in Congress but there's no contact, nobody asks me anything. I do my own work. My relations with the party are almost zero now."

368.title: 51-yr-old Mumbai civic official loses ₹81,500 online while seeking refund
368.article_body: A 51-year-old civic official from Mumbai was cheated of ₹81,500 in a cyber fraud while trying to receive a refund after returning the headphones he had purchased online. According to police, a person claiming to be an executive from the e-shopping portal asked the complainant to download a remote access app on his phone and siphoned ₹81,500 from his account.

369.title: At least 8 killed as flash floods hit central Italy
369.article_body: At least eight people have been killed by torrential overnight rains and floods in Italy's Marche region, authorities said. Around 400 millimetres of rain fell within two to three hours, inundating the streets of several towns around the region's capital Ancona. "We were given a normal alert for rain, but nobody had expected anything like this," an official said.

370.title: Jadeja would have added more value in India's T20 WC squad: Prasad
370.article_body: Talking about India's squad for upcoming T20 World Cup 2022, ex-India pacer Venkatesh Prasad said it's a balanced squad. "It has amazing batters and all-rounders. Ravindra Jadeja has missed out but would have added more value. Bowling looks very good. There are a lot of variations," he added. Jadeja was ruled out of the squad after undergoing knee surgery.

371.title: CBI team reaches Goa to investigate Sonali Phogat death case
371.article_body: A CBI team from Delhi has reached Goa to investigate the alleged murder case of actor Sonali Phogat. The Home Ministry had referred the case to the CBI after Goa Chief Minister Pramod Sawant wrote to the Union Home Minister Amit Shah, requesting a probe by the CBI. Police has so far arrested five people in connection with the case.

372.title: CSB Bank’s stock hits 6-month high after appointing Pralay Mondal as CEO & MD
372.article_body: A day after CSB Bank Limited announced the appointment of Pralay Mondal as the Managing Director and CEO, shares of the Kerala-based private lender hit a six-month high on Friday. At 2:20 pm, its shares were trading at a 2.55% high of ₹235.05 apiece on the NSE. Mondal has been appointed for a period of three years following RBI's approval.

373.title: Jharkhand CM meets Governor, asks for clarity on EC’s disqualification opinion
373.article_body: Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren met Governor Ramesh Bais and demanded a copy of the recommendation sent by Election Commission in the office of profit case. He also urged him to clear the confusion prevailing in the state over his continuation as an MLA. He alleged that the BJP is trying to destabilise his government by talking about the case.

374.title: Patanjali will launch 4 IPOs in next 5 years: Baba Ramdev
374.article_body: Yoga guru Baba Ramdev announced the initial public offering plans for four Patanjali Group companies over next five years. The companies expected to be listed on the stock market are Patanjali Ayurved, Patanjali Wellness, Patanjali Medicine and Patanjali Lifestyle. He also said that "the action plan" is "to achieve the target of ₹5 lakh crore market value in coming years".

375.title: Harsha Engineers IPO subscribed 74.6 times on 3rd and final day
375.article_body: The initial public offering of Harsha Engineers International was subscribed 74.6 times with bids for 125 crore equity shares against the offer size of 1.68 crore shares on Friday, the final day of bidding. Non-institutional investors subscribed 71.3 times, followed by retail investors subscribing 17.5 times the portion set aside for them. Qualified institutional buyers subscribed 178.26 times.

376.title: Gaganyaan, ISRO's 1st human space mission delayed due to COVID: Govt
376.article_body: Gaganyaan, India's first-ever human spaceflight mission by ISRO, scheduled to be launched in 2022, has been delayed due to COVID-19 pandemic, said Jitendra Singh, the Minister of State (Independent Charge) Science and Technology.  "COVID-19 pandemic had a toll on the training of astronauts in Russia as well as India," he said. The mission is anticipated to be launched by 2024.

377.title: Minor girl abducted by 2 men, sedated & gang-raped in Hyd; accused held
377.article_body: Two men have been arrested by Hyderabad's Dabeerpura Police after they allegedly kidnapped, sedated and gang-raped a 14-year-old girl at a hotel. "The...[accused] were arrested and a car was recovered from their possession, they have been remanded to judicial custody," ACP Prasad Rao said. The arrests were made after the girl's mother filed a complaint with the police.

378.title: Kyrgyzstan, Tajikistan report ‘heavy weapon’ use in border clash
378.article_body: Kyrgyzstan and Tajikistan on Friday accused each other of deploying heavy weaponry like mortars and tanks in an escalating conflict over a disputed mountainous frontier area that broke out two days ago. At least three people have been reportedly killed in the conflict so far. Leaders of both countries are currently attending a regional security summit in Uzbekistan.

379.title: Hansal uses Arbaaz's pic as he shares post on Federer's retirement, Twitter users react
379.article_body: Filmmaker Hansal Mehta shared a post after Roger Federer announced his retirement. He shared Arbaaz Khan's photo and wrote, "Going to miss you champion. #RogerFederer." "Best tweet on Federer's retirement," a Twitter user commented while another joked, "Hopefully you won't miss Federer's acting." Previously, social media users had pointed out resemblances in the appearance of Federer and Arbaaz.

380.title: 5-time IPL champions Mumbai Indians appoint Mark Boucher as head coach
380.article_body: Five-time IPL champions Mumbai Indians (MI) have appointed former South Africa wicketkeeper Mark Boucher as their head coach. Boucher, who has been South Africa's head coach since 2019, will quit the national role after the T20 World Cup 2022. Earlier, MI promoted Mahela Jayawardene and Zaheer Khan to global roles in the franchise.

381.title: India A squad for one-day series against New Zealand A announced, Samson named captain
381.article_body: The BCCI on Friday announced the India A squad for the upcoming one-day series against New Zealand A. Sanju Samson has been named captain of the squad. The squad includes Prithvi Shaw, Ruturaj Gaikwad, Rahul Tripathi, Kuldeep Yadav, Rahul Chahar, Shardul Thakur and Umran Malik. The three-match series will begin on September 22.

382.title: Samantha to play princess, Ayushmann a vampire in a horror-comedy: Reports
382.article_body: Actors Ayushmann Khurrana and Samantha Ruth Prabhu have reportedly teamed up for a horror-comedy film. According to reports, Samantha will play the role of a princess while Ayushmann will star as a vampire in the upcoming film, which will be backed by Dinesh Vijan's Maddock Films, the production house behind films like 'Stree', 'Roohi' and the upcoming 'Bhediya'.

383.title: India undoing ecological wrong by bringing back cheetahs: Union Minister
383.article_body: Union Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav on Friday said India is one of those countries that believe in undoing ecological wrongs. "Cheetahs became extinct in India due to overhunting. We have decided to bring the large carnivore back. This ecological wrong is being undone," Yadav added. Notably, eight cheetahs from Namibia will be introduced in India on September 17.

384.title: 90,000 people treated in 1 day for water-borne diseases in flood-hit Pak
384.article_body: Tens of thousands of people are suffering from infectious and water-borne diseases in flood-hit Pakistan, government data showed. More than 90,000 people were treated on Thursday in the Sindh province alone, one of the areas worst affected by flooding. The unprecedented floods have killed 1,508 people, including 536 children, in Pakistan, the country's National Disaster Management Authority said.

385.title: Kerala HC stays transfer of judge over 'sexually provocative dress' remark
385.article_body: Kerala HC stayed the transfer of Kozhikode sessions judge who had made "sexually provocative dress" remark. The judge had made the remark while granting anticipatory bail to social activist Civic Chandran in a sexual harassment case. He had said that the offence under Section 354A of IPC is not prima facie attracted if the woman is wearing "sexually provocative dresses".

386.title: Vijay is aggressive; Prabhas, Jr NTR are humble: RGV on 'Liger' failure
386.article_body: Speaking about the failure of 'Liger', filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma said that actor Vijay Deverakonda is "naturally aggressive" but the film flopped due to Karan Johar's association with it. "Another factor...is humility...The down-to-earth nature of [Jr NTR, Ram Charan and Prabhas] impressed the Hindi audience...Then Vijay came along with his natural aggressive speeches at 'Liger' events," he added.

387.title: Blackmailed using video, 14-yr-old girl raped by many at Gurugram spa
387.article_body: A 14-year-old girl was allegedly raped by several men at a Gurugram spa where she got a receptionist's job. She said that on her first day at the job, the spa operator forced her into a room where a man raped her. She alleged the operator blackmailed her using the incident's video, after which she was raped on multiple occasions.

388.title: 5 held in Thane for cheating e-commerce websites of ₹5.85 lakh
388.article_body: The Thane Police arrested five persons, including an MTech engineer and a call centre employee, for allegedly cheating Amazon and Flipkart of ₹5.85 lakh by submitting fake Aadhaar card details. The accused cheated the e-commerce retailers by placing orders for electronic gadgets and later returning the parcels filled with sand and old clothes instead of the actual products, police said.

389.title: Sidhu Moosewala's father hospitalised after complaining of uneasiness
389.article_body: Late singer Sidhu Moosewala's father Balkaur Singh has been admitted to a hospital in Punjab's Patiala. Balkaur Singh had complained of uneasiness on Thursday night following which he was admitted to the hospital. Member of Parliament Preneet Kaur and former Aam Aadmi Party leader Dharamvir Gandhi visited him at the hospital.

390.title: Interstate drug peddler held in Hyderabad; 550 kg marijuana seized
390.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police arrested a 36-year-old interstate drug peddler, identified as Venkatesh, and seized 550 kg marijuana from him. The police also seized a vehicle and two mobile phones from the accused. One of the accused, Vijay Prasad, allegedly asked Venkatesh, a taxi driver, to transport the contraband to Maharashtra and offered him a sum of ₹1.5 lakh per trip.

391.title: Sensex falls nearly 1,100 points, Nifty ends below 17,600
391.article_body: The benchmark indices ended in the red on Friday with the Sensex falling 1,093.22 points to 58,840.79. The Nifty ended 346.60 points lower at 17,530.80. Most sectors, including auto, IT, metal, banks and realty stocks plunged. Tech Mahindra, Infosys and M&M were among the top losers on the exchanges. Nifty Midcap 100 and Smallcap 100 fell in range of 2.5%-3%.

392.title: Sonal Chauhan fractures foot, completes 'The Ghost' action sequence
392.article_body: Actress Sonal Chauhan recently fractured her foot during MMA training for her film 'The Ghost' and was advised to avoid any training or action scenes for six weeks. The actress completed shooting an action sequence for the film despite her injury. A picture of Sonal with her foot in the plaster is going viral on social media.

393.title: 'Chup: Revenge of the Artist' was wrapped in 45 days: Sunny Deol
393.article_body: Actor Sunny Deol has stated that his upcoming film 'Chup: Revenge of the Artist' was shot within 45 days by director R Balki. "He is really a great professional with a great vision. He knows what he wants and is very precise with his work," Sunny added. The film also features Dulquer Salmaan, Shreya Dhanwanthary and Pooja Bhatt.

394.title: Wife finds out her husband was a woman 8 years after marriage in Gujarat; FIR filed
394.article_body: A woman in Gujarat's Vadodara approached the police against her husband of eight years after learning that he has allegedly undergone gender affirmation surgery. The woman said the accused went to Kolkata in 2020 for surgery to implant male organs in his body under the false pretext of undergoing minor surgery. An FIR has been registered in the case.

395.title: KGF 2 created history, saved Kannada film industry: Mahesh Manjrekar
395.article_body: Actor-filmmaker Mahesh Manjrekar has stated that Yash-starrer 'K.G.F: Chapter 2' saved the Kannada film industry which seemed like "it would shut down anytime". "But there was one person who believed in making a film and spending a lot of money on it. That person made a film named KGF and it created history," Mahesh said.

396.title: 3 arrested after encounter with police in Ghaziabad
396.article_body: Three men were arrested by Ghaziabad Police on Friday following an encounter in the Loni border area, police informed. Firearms and stolen property were recovered from them, police added. One of the accused was reportedly shot in the leg while a fourth one managed to escape. The encounter occurred after the accused tried to evade a routine check, police said.

397.title: Haryana Police to expedite training of 5,000 officers amid rise in cybercrime
397.article_body: The crime branch of Haryana Police has decided to speed up online training of over 5,000 willing policemen and officers in cybercrime investigation. The move has been initiated so that police can cope with rising number of cybercrimes in the state. Notably, 36,996 cybercrime complaints were received by state police till August this year, Haryana ADGP (Crime) OP Singh said.

398.title: 100 families in dark after supply cut in Noida society over power theft by builder
398.article_body: At least 100 families in Noida's Hilston Urbtech Society have been living in total blackout for four days after the electricity supply was snapped following allegations of power theft against the builder. The builder had reportedly taken a temporary connection of 50kW during construction. He didn't take a permanent connection later and continued to supply 750kW power from same line.

399.title: Mother asks Delhi HC to let 16-yr-old daughter terminate pregnancy
399.article_body: A woman has approached the Delhi High Court seeking permission to terminate the pregnancy of her 16-year-old daughter. The minor girl is over 17 weeks pregnant as per the ultrasound scan. The pregnancy is said to have resulted from a consensual and close relationship. The petitioner's lawyer said the girl is not physically and mentally prepared to raise a child.

400.title: BTech aspirant leaves home in Pune as father forces him to study medicine
400.article_body: A 17-year-old youth ran away from home in Pune and went missing on Tuesday, following an argument with his father over studies and phone usage. He was found at his uncle's house in Dighi. An engineering aspirant, the boy told police he left home as he wanted to pursue computer science, but his father was forcing him to study medicine.

401.title: House collapses in Delhi's Johripur Extension; 6 rescued, 2 trapped
401.article_body: A house collapsed in Johripur Extension in Northeast Delhi on Friday afternoon, Delhi Fire Service (DFS) said. "So far, six persons have been rescued...it is suspected that two more are there," DFS chief Atul Garg added. The rescue work is underway, he added. A video of the incident purportedly shows the house collapsing inwards while the walls remain intact.
